review_content:
Pils malt aroma, sulfur, minerally, dry grass, sweet biscuit malt.  
Pours a clear light gold with fluffy white head
Slight sour pils malt tang with biscuity malt and light earthy hop.  
Light bodied,  high co2, quick finish.  
It’s fine.  That’s about it.  Easy to drink, non offensive, not interesting.

Sampled @ Starkbierzeit 2016. My cream jelleg, viszont ami a borsodit dicséri: a licensz alapján elég jól sikerült másolni.

Revisited 2021 from bottom of bottle.
a legújabb kutatások szerint az ókori görögországban virágzott a sörkultúra és nagyban hódoltak a tiszta halovány sima szemcsés maláta-hangsúlyos alkoholos erjesztett gabonalének száraz lágy finissel. innen is kapta a nevét a birodalom (tudniillik Hellász), de aztán az egész, ahogy az ókori görög matematika is, feledésbe merült, mígnem....

500 ml can. Pours clear golden with a foamy head. Citrussy notes, a bit skunky, malty, hay, light grassy hops, metallic notes, dough. Medium bitterness, slightly sweet. Medium bodied, oily texture, lively to soft carbonated, mild dry bittersweet finish. Just ok.
Fin lys lettere gennemsigtig. Meget hvidt og rigeligt fint skum. Svag humleduft. Frisk meget lidt bitter og let fylde. Giver en let eftersmag, der giver en masse fine toner af humlen.

Im Glas hellgoldgelb mit angemessen schöner feiner Perlage. Die weiße, fein- bis mittelporige Schaumkrone zeigt sich gut stabil und ebenso gut haltbar.
Im Duft leicht getreidig, grasig und etwas muffig - aber nicht übel muffig, sondern eher urig-muffig.
Der Antrunk kommt frisch, gut spritzig und leicht würzig-malzig. Am Gaumen vernimmt man gute getreidige bis brotige, leicht süßliche Malzaromen - ganz typisch bayerisch hell. Die ebenso typische zarte Würze und die beinahe vollständig ausbleibende Hopfenaromatik rundet das Profil dieses Bierstils ab. Die Haptik wirkt vielleicht ein bisschen zu rezent, aber durchaus okay. Der doch recht guten Süffigkeit tut das aber keinen Abbruch.
Im Abgang flacht dieses Helle aber leider etwas zu rasch ab und eine leichte, trockene bis aschige Hopfenaromatik bleibt übrig.
Auch wenn es bessere bayerische Helle gibt, bleibt dieses Bier eines der gut trinkbaren und darf mit Fug und Recht als typisches bayerisches Helles bezeichnet werden.
Bottle. Nose is grass light malt getting cereal; clean. Taste is malty, cereal, honey, leading to lightly floral hop.
Bright yellow color with a thin white head. Malty aroma with a biscuit note, but it was  a bit skunky as well. The taste was biscuit dough. Ok, if we can get pass the nose.
Bottle. Clear golden color with a thin head. Mild aroma of hay and malt. Malty taste with some sweetness. Medium thin body.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso propende per l'orzo. L'olfatto viene stimolato in maniera normale, permanendo in maniera sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma resiste abbastanza. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. Il liquido è di consistenza limpida. Il colore è giallo dorato brillante. Il corpo è rotondo. L'amaro è normale. La forza gustativa è normale e permane in maniera sufficiente. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano di pronta beva. Il finale è semplice e dissetante. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. Il tetto della bocca riconosce impressioni di miele, pane, biscotto, erbaceo e agrumi.

0,5l can from BillaPlus grocery store in Hainburg an der Donau. Foam is medium, white, quick gone. Colour is pale gold, clear. Aroma is malty, bit bready, straw grassy. Taste is light to medium malty base, watery bready, light caramel, bit grassy, soft to medium carbonation, ok, drinkable.
Buona corposità, lieve punta fruttata, sentore alcolico moderato, beverina, molto gradevole

Flasche 500 ml
Farbe: Gold 
Geruch: getreidig grasig
Geschmack: süffig, getreidig spritzig.

Kaufen kaufen kaufen

Nalewa sie jasne złoto, klarowne, ładna piana.
W zapachu słodko, słodowo, lekko kwiatki, 
W smaku sporo kwiatków fajne słodowe, jak na zwyczajnego hellesika to ok. Jakaś nawet delikatna ziołowoa goryczka jesT.

Tasted several times.
[#3.868 Global - #346 Germany - #5 Spaten Franziskaner]
Pale golden colour with a minimal white head. Aroma: Wheat, grass and light dough. Taste: Grainy and malty leading to a light floral bitter finish.
Next one please!

1 litre bottle from draft.
Clear gold, thin white head. Aroma of creamy malts, citrus, vegetable starch. Taste is semi-sweet malts, some caramel, lemon, light flora. A bit cleaner than the aroma suggested. Smooth body, medium carbonation. Nothing special but its enjoyable enough.
Pils malt aroma, sulfur, minerally, dry grass, sweet biscuit malt. Pours a clear light gold with fluffy white head Slight sour pils malt tang with biscuity malt and light earthy hop.…
Sampled @ Starkbierzeit 2016. My cream jelleg, viszont ami a borsodit dicséri: a licensz alapján elég jól sikerült másolni.…

500 ml can. Pours clear golden with a foamy head. Citrussy notes, a bit skunky, malty, hay, light grassy hops, metallic notes, dough. Medium bitterness, slightly sweet. Medium bodied, oily texture, lively to soft carbonated, mild dry bittersweet finish. Just…
Fin lys lettere gennemsigtig. Meget hvidt og rigeligt fint skum. Svag humleduft. Frisk meget lidt bitter og let fylde. Giver en let eftersmag, der giver en masse fine toner af humlen.

Bottle. Nose is grass light malt getting cereal; clean. Taste is malty, cereal, honey, leading to lightly floral hop.
Bright yellow color with a thin white head. Malty aroma with a biscuit note, but it was  a bit skunky as well. The taste was biscuit dough. Ok, if we can get pass the nose.
Bottle. Clear golden color with a thin head. Mild aroma of hay and malt. Malty taste with some sweetness. Medium thin body.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso propende per l'orzo. L'olfatto viene stimolato in maniera normale, permanendo in maniera sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma resiste abbastanza. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. Il liquido è di consistenza limpida. Il colore è…

0,5l can from BillaPlus grocery store in Hainburg an der Donau. Foam is medium, white, quick gone. Colour is pale gold, clear. Aroma is malty, bit bready, straw grassy. Taste is light to medium malty base, watery bready, light caramel, bit grassy, soft to medium…
Buona corposità, lieve punta fruttata, sentore alcolico moderato, beverina, molto gradevole
Flasche 500 ml Farbe: Gold Geruch: getreidig grasig…
Nalewa sie jasne złoto, klarowne, ładna piana. W zapachu słodko, słodowo, lekko kwiatki, W smaku sporo kwiatków fajne słodowe, jak na zwyczajnego hellesika to ok. Jakaś…
Tasted several times. [#3.868 Global - #346 Germany - #5 Spaten Franziskaner] Pale golden colour with a minimal white head. Aroma: Wheat, grass and light dough.…
1 litre bottle from draft. Clear gold, thin white head. Aroma of creamy malts, citrus, vegetable starch. Taste is semi-sweet malts, some caramel, lemon, light flora. A bit cleaner than the aroma…
Klar lys gylden med hvitt skum. Aroma og smak malt humle honning karamell. Fin fylde og lett bitterhet, fint humlet øl. Smakt Mars 2014

Golden color, weak white head. 
Aroma of malt and hops. 
Malty taste, good mouthfeel, a bit hoppier than the average.
Good everyday Helles, a bit on the hoppier side.

Bottle, 500ml. Pours clear light yellow with a green tint, white foamy and short head. Scent is lemon and hop. Carbonation is medium to soft but pleasant, body is light with some crispness and some silkiness. Taste is lightly bitter, with mild but notable sweetness and some pleasant lemony acidity. Flavors of citrusy hops, strong pale malt, lemon, mild straw, lager fermentation, mild unpleasant hop notes, a bit skunky, honey. Light crisp lager with a nice lemony profile, quite drinkable and not too boring.

50cl bottle also had in can. Tried many times without going too crazy over this one but i loved the Spaten Oktoberfestbier so i tried it again. Pours clear pale golden with quickly disappearing white head. Very easy and straight forward Helles, very sweet. Aroma is grassy and malt. Taste is quite appreciable, simple but good of sweet malt, grains, bread, some grassy hops, touch of honey like feel in the mouth.. remember there were some light metallic notes in the past ones i had but not this time. Really easy and sweet, good carbonation and crisp, could be a little more rich but overall quite a good helles. I still prefer others but i will definitely have this one again, i quite like it. Reminds me of München and the many helles i had while there.

Aussehen: klares gelb gold, weiße gröbere flüchtige krone, stark carbonisiert

Aroma: minimal hefig sauer

Antrunk: leichte Säure
Midtrunk: minimale herb
Abgang: minimal herb mit leichtem graß
Mundgefühl: prikeln und erfrischend

Fazit: ein helles. Recht mild und süffig.

50cl bottle from Beer Hawk.
medium white head.  Clear golden pour.  Easy drinking.

Colore giallo oro, schiuma color panna, fine, alta e persistente.
Al naso lievi sentori erbacei; in bocca riesco a sentire solo la secchezza del luppolo nel finale.
Carbonazione media.
Una birra dal sapore molto leggero (troppo per i miei gusti...)
Spaten München 5.2%. Golden, pale malt aroma, medium bodied, sweet pale malt, corn, honey. Pleasant Helles Lager from Munich 🇩🇪

Bottle. Clear golden color, fine white head. Light grassy, cracker cereal aroma. Medium dry taste, medium bitterness. Crisp, cracker malty aftertaste, with a herbal hoppy note. Full body, medium carbonation.
Bottle, can’t remember where from. Light golden colour, bright with a fine foam. Soft malt, hint of noble hop, light bitterness, clean. Solid example of style.
Another of the great Munich pilsners. Smell of hops and metal. Light, crisp and refreshing when serve gold. Slight taste of cinnamon and toffee apple.
Goud geel bier met een stevige witte schuimkraag. Het bier heeft een mooi diep bittere smaak met een stevig granig aroma. Ook is er een klein kruidje en citrusje te proeven.
Bouteille 50cl couleur blonde dorée mousse blanche qui ne tient pas goût sur la céréale, boisé, vanille
Pours clear, light amber with one finger, white head.  Aroma is grass and caramel.  Taste is caramel, moving to light grassy notes.  Finish is all caramel.
Very good refreshing classic beer. You know what to expect and you get exactly that.

With a head frothier than Des Lynam's homemade oxtail soup this goes down a treat. Slightly drier than Su Pollard's best tea towel. A little bit too dry actually. 

Good.

10-JUL-2020, bottle @hotel in Hamburg, from local shop. 
Clear golden with a high, white head. 
Straw, spice, grass, apple. Lively carbonation, sweet, bitter. Fine but not all that great lager.

Strong carbonation.herbs.dry and sweet.mildly hoppy.malty.a great german.
Bbf:10/02/2021.
Helle Farbe mit mittelgroßer Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Malz. Im Antrung etwas lasch, dafür aber im weiteren Verlauf umso erfrischender. Aromen von dunklem Brot, Heu und Gras.

Viel ist nicht übrig geblieben von der einst so traditionsreichen Spaten-Brauerei. Das "Münchner Hell" ist eines der letzten 3 Biere die unter diesem Label verkauft werden.

Fängt recht vollmundig an, läuft dann aber schlank aus. Etwas Getreide, etwas Frucht, etwas bitter gallig. Durchaus schön weich und süffig. Alles nicht unangenehm, aber auch nichts das einem zu Begeisterungsstürmen hinreist. Rangiert irgendwo im oberen Mittelfeld der Industriebieren. Man macht mit dem Kauf absolut nichts falsch, aber außer Münchner Lokalpatriotismus sehe ich auch keine zwingenden Gründe die dafür sprechen.
bottle at nicks.. Light Golden... thin white beans light dry floral fruit nose.. Light dry peach  grain.. soft fruit
Bottle at Nick's.  Pours clear golden, nose is grass, toffee, herbs, taste is sweet, grassy, cereal.

Classic bavarian helles, low hops malt based. Slight carbonation small crown. Color reminds me of a kristal weizn. 

Ok in taste, flushes down really quick, i can imagine that some ppl can consume in in large litre numbers in spaten tent on oktoberfest. 

But be aware it ends in a headache even by small amounts. So its not really worth it.

Eigentlich eines der alt-ehrwürdigen Münchner Brauhäuser. Nach einigen Verkäufen und Zusammenlegungen bei AB Inbev gelandet. Das muss nicht unbedingt heißen, dass es ein primitives Industriebier ist, das einfach flach schmeckt um einehohe Drinkability zu liefern -bei diesem ist es aber genau so.
Kann man trinken, aber mir schmecken andere besser.
Love this. Clean, crisp and clear. Smooth, malt flavours and thoroughly refreshing.

Spaten ist eine der wenigen Brauereien, deren Biere mir massive Kopfschmerzen am nächsten Tag beschwert haben. Spricht nicht unbedingt für die besten Zutaten. Ich geb dem Hellen aber noch eine Chance. In der Nase arg süßlich, im Trunk aber zurückhaltender, malzig, Getreide, fast crispy, wenig Nachhall. Das passt schon, warten wir mal was der Kopf dazu sagt.

Flasche 0,5l: Helles Gold, glasklar, kräftiger stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; leicht fruchtige + dezent würzige Nase, malzige Süße, leichte Hopfenaromen, Malz, Getreide, leichte Hefearomen, leichte fruchtige Säure, Brotteig, Sauerteig, malzig-trockene Bitterkeit; leicht fruchtiger + leicht würziger Körper, malzige Süße, leichte Hopfenaromen, leichte Zitrusnoten, Malz, Getreide, cremig, deutliche Kohlensäure, dezente trockene Säure, leichte Hefearomen; angenehmer malzig-trockener Nachgang

50 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Edeka, Kleve.
Clear golden with a white head. Malty grainy aroma with some metallic notes. Sweet taste with a low bitter taste. Standard solid helles.

Pachnie typowo, jasny słód, lekka siarka i trochę ziołowego chmielu. Czysta słodowość, żadnych estrów ani tym podobnych historii. Jest mineralność, musuje na języku. Goryczka niska, trochę ziół ale generalnie bardzo grzecznie. Przyzwoity niemiecki klasyk
Если бы мне налили это пиво в слепую - я бы сказал, что это мерзкая обычная пастеризованная светлая ужасная Балтика. На сайтах его рекомендуют, хвалят. Не понимаю почему. Полная фигня
Flesje gedeeld met Tomhendriksen en Benzai. Goudgeel helder bier met matig schuim. Aroma van de koeienstal. Smaak is zoetig en een beetje hoppig. Weinig nasmaak, iets bitter.
Fles gedeelt door Inoven geprobeerd met Benzai. Het is een helder goudgeel bier. Het heeft een moutige wat urine achtige geur (wtf). De smaak is moutig zacht zoet en wat waterig.

Ar: slodowe, jednorodne, intensywnosc srednia. Wyg: slomkowo-zlotawe, klar. piana ultra drobna, ring, ok. Sm: wysycenie wysokie, wodniste, mocno slodowe, lagerowosc, lekka lagerowa gorycza. Pos: slod, lekka lagerowa goryczka. Sm: niezle, ale bez szalu.
En av de bättre pilsnerölen. Lättdrucken på ett bra sätt. Fin gul färg, bra skumkrona. Fin smak med en lite gräsig efterton. Flaska 50cl.
Clear golden appearance. Aroma is malt, corn and grassy. Flavour is sweet, grassy, malt and corn.

Tap. Clayton Hotel, Manchester Airport. Clear gold. Barely a head. Decent grassy hop, and fairly clean grain. Touch of caramel. Smells ok. Taste errs toward sweet, with some grassy bitterness. Light to medium body. Fine carbonation. Light bitter finish.

Clear golden with a frothy but fast dissipating head.
Strawy, metallic smell with an apple note. Smooth taste with nice hoppy, floral notes. Low carbonation.
An utmost drinkable beer, it goes down the throat like nothing.
Aromat słodowy, lagerowy. W smaku słodowe, lekko słodkie. Nic specjalnego..

9/10/2019. Draft at Spatenhaus an der Oper, Munich, Germany. Poured clear golden with a good size white head. Aroma of hops, malt, fruit and straw. Medium sweetness, moderate bitterness. Moderate body, oily texture, average carbonation. Not bad to go with the meal we had there.
500 ml bottle. Grass smell (better than the usual lager) Gold color low head. Google "beer" in google and this what this beer looks like. Taste is average, but well made. DEUTSCHLAND! average/good

500ml bottle brewed in Germany at 5.2%. Pale golden. Medium, not-too-long lasting head. Aroma somewhere in between pear and sweetcorn. Moderate carbonation. Very straightforward lager. Equal parts grass, sweetcorn and bready malt, but all are so dialed down that it just becomes one flavour, completely dodging eaches potential naffness. Not dissimilar to Heineken (the hop extract connection, perhaps?). Cool and refreshing, with an entirely inoffensive taste (rarer among lagers than you might think...). Nothing to recommend for the beer-savourers; nothing to fault for the thirst-quenchers. Therefore I can't rate this too highly, but certainly not too lowly. Of course, for the price, most wouldn't think it was worth it, but hey ho. Worth drinking a bottle if you want to set yourself a baseline for lager - anything better than this is definitely good lager, anything worse probably isn't.
Can. historical beer as long as I heard. sweet maltiness. can’t feel any dominating hops or aftertaste. Great one for thirst. A bit higher ABV than plain lager beers.
Uzupełnienie ocen piwnych bez opisu z uwagi na przeniesienie z papierowych zapisków.

Bue sous la tente à l'Oktoberfest. 
Robe dorée, bien brillante. Mousse épaisse, crémeuse, bonne tenue jusqu'à la fin du litre.
Arômes céréales, floral, foin, un peu agrumes et fruits jaunes. Goût plutôt équilibré entre un sucré résiduel assez présent et une amertume légère. 
Honorable.

(500ml bottle, Berlin)
AROMA: lager nose,soft grain, 
APPEARANCE: clear golden yellow, visible carbonation, small short-lived head
TASTE: slightly sweet, light grain, wheat, hint of bread and dough, and nonharsh light hops, some green grass
PALATE: light, soft, oily, 

OVERALL: a very easy to drink German lager. A bit light, a bit simple,but nice on the palate and could be a good every day beer.
Riecht hopfig zitronig. Goldenes Bier, mit einer schnell einfallenden feinen Schaumkrone. Der Antrunk ist leicht zitronig lasch.  Insgesamt sehr mild. Angenehme Säure.

Złociste, klarowne.
Piana biała, wysoka, dość trwała.
Aromat słodowy, trochę trawiasty.
W smaku podobnie z lekką goryczką.
The easiest one to drink of the variety. Lots of malt. Reminds me how much better American beer is than European. They beat us on tradition but their beer has been outdone by American microbrews.

On tap at Spatenhaus an der Oper in Munich. Clear light gold color with a big fluffy white head. Aroma is grainy with a hint of grass. Taste of grass, hay, cracker, noble hops and sweet malt. Low bitterness, medium carbonation. Drinkable, not memorable. Tasted on 8/15/19.

Pours a clear, golden coloration with a large, fluffy head and very slightly visible carbonation. Smells of doughy malt and grassy, citrus hops. Taste is an excellent balance of doughy, slightly grainy malt and grassy, citrus hops, with some light floral and herbal accents. Finishes with a light/medium bitterness and some grassy, citrus hops lingering in the aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel with a medium body and carbonation. Reading through some of the reviews here, I have to wonder how fresh people are drinking this. It's actually quite a hoppy Helles at less than 3 months old, with a rather nice citrus presence as well as some grassy and much ligher floral and herbal notes. I really like the relatively strong hoppiness and rather light sweetness in this one, making it extremely crushable and surpremely refreshing. My favorite barbecue beer this summer.

08-08-19 // on tap at Salon 3Sein Mainz.

Plain solid Helles. Sweetish but also a mild bitterness.

Shared bottle at home. Pours clear golden with white head. Aroma of hay, light bread, light malt, some floral notes, DMS. Tastes slightly sweet with balancing bitterness. Thin bodied, slightly bitter finish.
Smells like basic beer nice and refreshing and clean when drunk cold. Not much else to say.  Fine enough.

OK, this sort of thing ISN'T my bag, but I got it in BeerHawk's poor value Mystery Case (Mystery is why they thought people would buy this)
Looks great, smells yeasty, tastes of bedsit carpet.
Vile.
We used the other bottle to cook with.

Okay hops and malts aroma. A good salad can easily drown it out.
Taste is really well-balanced, malty with a slight touch of hoppy bitterness.
Good, watery mouthfeel. 
Not superior or interesting, just high quality.

Złociste, klarowne piwo z piękną białą pianą która ładnie zdobi szkło. Aromat delikatny słodowy, zbożowy trochę trawy i kwiatów. W smaku lekkie, orzeźwiające, głównie akcenty słodowe, praktycznie brak goryczki.
Decent helles lager. Looks good, tastes OK, A liitle on the wsweet side for me butacceptable
Bottle at Berliner Betrüger - so Spaten is launching a big PR campaign in Hamburg now: Lass dir raten, trinke Spaten! Na, dann. a mediocre Helles, a bit malty, a bit watery, overall refrehing. okay.

In Bavaria they like to call a spade a spade. Especially if you’re  a beer, which they also like to call a Spade. Literally. 
As has been well documented beer has experienced a real renaissance in recent years, especially amongst the New wave craft brewery’s who really ate taking beer ‘to the limit and beyond’. It is nice therefore to remind ourselves once in a while that some people have been doing this for centuries. German Monks mainly.
 Spartan is one of Bavaria’s core beers bound by their purity laws. This makes it so excellent. A clear golden pour, crisp refreshing and date that slips down so smoothly. And a finish that plays your spine like a xylophone! Delicious 
Prost!

Butelka. Slomkowy, klarowny, piana jakas jest ale niezbyt obfita. Aromat najpierw jajo ale potem brzeczkowy, zbozowy, troche miodku. Niezbyt. Lekkie, slodowe, niska goryczka, w smaku slod pilznenski, chmielu zero. Rozpuszczalnik wychodzi po ogrzaniu.
Kein schönes Helles. Dafür mit zu viel bitter herber Kante. Die Wertigkeit der Zutaten tragen dann noch ihren Anteil bei.

Bottle. Clear light gold with a big fluffy white head. Aroma and taste of grass, hay, cracker, noble hops and sweet malts. Low bitterness, medium carbonation. It's alright for sure but it  won't make my list of go-to-Helles.
A light yellow beer, a head is medium and white. Aroma is alsmost just pure maltyness, might be some grass. Taste has maltynes, some grass and sweetness of honey. Medium bodied. Pure and malty.
Robe or limpide, mousse et carbo OK. Nez malté doux, bouche légère, maltée, un peu de grain (pas trop), amertume peu agréable. Ensemble assez fade.
Bottle in College days, darker golden with a medium head. Notes of cracker, toast, grain, malt, and grass. Not awful for an InBev but wouldn't buy it these days. Light to medium body
A solid grainy helles, Just a touch too bitter for my favourites in the style. But clean, and beautifully clear. netto dresden. One of the best helles there is.

Half litre bottle poured into pint shaker. A: Pale golden colour, clear, small head which disappeared quickly, didn't leave much lacing. S: Honey, hay malt and noble hops. T: Malt forward, honey with slight hint of apple. M: Medium body, low to moderate carbonation. O: A beer which comes from a long line of well made Bavarian Helles, not a hop bomb or a rich imperial stout, but worked very well as a thirst quencher.

12 oz green bottle. Smells like a lager, no off-odors. Light yellow with a touch of orange. Clear. Taste has a touch of sweetness, don't really get much hops from this, except that I know it balances the beer. Finish is forgetful. Overall an OK inoffensive lager.

The aroma is weak .. The delicate smell of hops and a little bit of malt.
Taste: The body is hard beer, for Hell. An excellent balance of bitterness and malt sweetness.
Kolor złoty, lekki lager, piana utrzymująca się kilkanaście minut. Kukurydziany posmak

A bottle from a 6pack, November 2019 bb date so that is ~4 months old, green bottle of course. 

Looks all too common, pale gold with minimal head of foam. 

Smells grassy, grainy, and light struck. 

Taste is grassy which is good, grainy and sweet which ain't so good. Overall, slightly more bitter than sweet which is okay by me. 

Usual mouthfeel for the style. 

Single bottles weren't an option so..I'm stuck with 5 more bottles. I'll survive.
Clear golden color with white head, aroma is grainy, grassy and malty, taste is medium bitter / medium sweet, medium body, medium carbonation, ok.

Ultimately, this sounds like a good beer, it sounds like an interesting beer, it has depth, it’s made with quality, it’s better than most pilsners, probably? But it’s not a beer that will be remembered, as it’s too different, but not different enough.

Find the full review here:

www.beerwithus1.wordpress.com/2019/02/12/spaten-lager
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.
Cerveza con una cabeza espumosa media, de carbonatación baja y con un cuerpo ligero. Aroma a malta y hierbas. En boca destaca la malta, es apenas dulce y con un ligero amargor.

This is a decent beer. Not one I'd go out of my way for or rush back to but it's fine. Nothing unpleasant lurking in the aftertaste, nothing to make it undrinkable and cholled it's perfectly pleasant. There's just nothing that in even so much as a week's time would make me say to a friend, "Oh! You know what you should try?"
Bottle from Hopt. Aroma is grainy malt with straw, cereal and soft noble hops. Flavour is a bit sweetish with a light bitterness. Medium body. Drinkable if not very memorable Helles.

En botella de 500ml de Gadis.

Color amarillo claro, completamente transparente, sin apenas corona ni retención.

Aroma algo dulce a malta y berberechos.

Sabor plano, algo de malta, amargor moderado, cuerpo acuoso. Carbonatacion más bien baja para el estilo.
A nice pilsner/lager with good foam.  Easy to drink any sunny day with friends

Lets leave aside that this company is owned by In Bev--for my money it is still a decent drink in this Munich-brewed version. It pours a mid-gold yellow, with a 1cm thick, lasting head. Carbonation is slow, like a snow globe. The innocuous smell is light and lagery. The subdued carbonation turns to softness on the tongue, as the flavour opens out into a finely honeyed breadiness. The beer is very light, like a soufflée. Despite the full mouthful, this is a light, soft beer. A hops dimension opens out in the late stages of the taste, but with a warm, friendly bitterness that doesn't overstay its welcome into the aftertaste. The beer does get duller as it warms up, so I am sure it is at its best well chilled. A decent Bavarian Hell Lager, then--but not on the level of the Augustiner Hell, the Hofbrauhaus Jägerbier Hell, or the Mittenwalder Karwendel Hell, in my opinion. None the less, it blows most industrial lagers into the water.

2015 BJCP Category: 4A Munich Helles


AROMA: Fairly strong skunky scent due to green bottle. Otherwise a lightly sweet, clean grain malt presence of pure pilsner malt. Faint Noble hop spicy scent. 8/12

APPEARANCE: Pale golden hue (2-3 SRM); extremely clear. Small, white foamy head never completely evaporates. 2/3

FLAVOR: Moderately sweet clean pilsner malt throughout. A touch of authentic honey flavor in the background grows a little stronger on the finish and lingers in the aftertaste briefly. Spicy Noble hops are present, but mild and subtle. Palette is definitely more malty than hoppy, but far from cloying. Would probably be a perfect score if not for the lightstrike flaw. 18/20

MOUTHFEEL: Medium-light body; medium carbonation. Smooth, crisp and refreshing with slight malty sweet aftertaste. Highly sessionable even at 5.2% ABV. 4/5

OVERALL IMPRESSION: Pretty much the progenitor of the style and still one of the better examples after all these years. If only it were in cans! 8/10

TOTAL SCORE: 40/50

Crystal clear pale yellow with a 3-finger an off-white head and good lacing. 

Aroma of grain, grass, mild floral notes and a little lemon. 

Taste of grain, mild citrus and a touch of grass. 

Medium/light body and medium/low carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Keg @ Victorian Craft Beer Café, Halifax. Carbonated golden lager with a thin head. Clearly continental with its German malt and maltiness.
A very light and crispy beer from tap at Spaten brau Haus in München. Citric notes very discretely on nose and in taste. Palate classic short. Refreshing beer.

Brown/Tan bottle, 500ml. Pours pale golden yellow with a thin white head subsiding quickly. Scent is light lager and a tiny bit of flowers. Taste is light lager and very plain and watery. Finish is a little dry and otherwise no unsavory properties. Good.

A beer that has an ambiguous side to it. It is a Helle that one can taste out of a group, and while at first I thought this was not so good, having lived in Munich for a long time now, this beer has grown on me. The distinctivness has become positive over the years.

May ’15. A 0.5 l bottle from a supermarket, enjoyed at the wonderful English Garden park in Munich. Another one that was skipped it so many times, I really had to buy it. Grain, raw eggs and hay aroma. Flavor was lightly sweet, very lightly, followed the aroma with a bit of bitterness towards the end. Thinner in body with shorter, lightly herbal bitter and honey/egg sweetish finish. Not so bad as it may sound, just simple and light. Refreshing and by the all means mediocre pale lager.
Bottle from shop in Cap Salou, Catalonia, Spain. Pale gold beer with large head. Aroma of light malt and a touch of perfume. Taste is light malt, grassy, some herb and bread. Not bad.
?rednio obfita piana, ?adny lacing. Klarowne z?oto. Aromat s?odowy, siarkowy, niezbyt rze?ki. Puste w smaku, kiepsko.

Clara dourada,límpida,brilhante,espuma bem formada com média duração;aroma maltado com leve floral;sabor igualmente maltado com pequeno amargor finalizando,corpo e carbonatação medianos,final meio seco com retrogosto maltado. Helles leve,saborosa,refrescante,amargor um pouco abaixo para o estilo.mas no geral uma boa cerveja.
From Hipercor. In Bavaria glass. After dinner. Good maltyness, with more bitterness than usual in the style. Nice mouthfilling feel. Easy drinking. A pity its ugly look, with no foam.

Originally rated on 9/4/08. I didnt rate this on higher because i am basing my score on the mini-keg version since i tried that last. I dont think i will ever buy any beer from a mini keg again since every single time there is an overwhelming metallic taste. Other than that Spaten pours a mid to dark yellow body, average carbonation, thin white head, not much lace. Flavor of corn and some malts, kinda sweet for a lager. Overall a fairly average beer.

500 ml can. Pours a very pale yellow with a large white head. Aromas are light grains and grass. Light grains with a very subtle hop presence. Thin body, watery, little to finish. A mass-produced beer without any character.
12 oz. bottle. Pours clear golden. Minimal white head. Aroma was grassy and malty. Taste was sweet.

looked as expected. plenty of sweet malt up-front and then some strange berry bitterness-tartness. a little water. as zieglerbrau helles on tap in dachau. typical sweet hay aroma. very pale with very light bitterness and a hint of raw sugar. standard helles made to seem a bit better by being very fresh
Classica lager tedesca industriale. Sentori erbacei e di cereali, con finale leggermente secco. Dissetante, ma niente di più.
Classic yellow body with a a nice white head and good lacing. Aroma is grains, grass and a little skunky. Taste is smooth classic Euro-lager. Clean finish, enjoyable.

Bottle.
Light yellow with a big, frothy white head.
Aroma is grassy, slightly herbal hoppy, some cereal/light malt.
Taste is mostly sweet with cereals/cornflakes and some hop bitterness.
Medium body, high, prickly carbonation, dry mouth feel.
Short sweet and herbal bitter after taste.


I recall this beeing a better beer. Seems more bland than before. Too sweet IMO.

Hm. I used to like this a lot more. Aromas and palate now seem bland, simple, one-dimensional. Dare I say almost "Americanized." Dumbed down for mass appeal. The kind of a beer I can’t wait to finish so I can move on to something else. Disappointing.

Baught as Spaten München.
L: Pours clear straw with 2.5 fingers thick white head.
S: Leafy hop flavor.
T: A bit bready, with hoppy finish.
F: light bodied with excellent carbonization.
O: Good lager.
As lager. Clear liquid with minimal white head. Aroma of hay, caramel, straw. Tastes same. Light body. Av carbo.
cerveza rubia tipo bock, baja fermentación, refrescante con mucho sabor, baja graduacion

Color amarillo oro con media corona de espuma blanca de burbuja grande y ligera retención, aromas a malta, débil lúpulo , pan y ligero diacetilo; en boca entrada suave y refrescante con sutil amargor, balanceada hacia la malta, cuerpo y carbónico medio-ligero, retrogusto maltoso y ligeramente dulce, fácil de beber pero sin nada destacable.
Pours a light and clear straw with a white fluffy head. Aroma of sweet malt. Bitter taste, mildly refreshing.
Clear straw color with medium foamy white head. Grassy and nutty aroma. Crisp thin mouthfeel. Slightly floral hop and weak toasty malt flavor. Medium carbonation and light aftertaste of floral hops.

500 ml bottle. Pale straw golden colour with thick two finger white head. Fades gradually. Aroma of light sweet malts, corn, grassy hops. Tastes light and smooth: sweet malts, grain with a small bitter touch of hops on the top of the tongue. Sticky and crispy beer. Well, it’s a nice beer when you watch a football match or whatever.

11-12 oz bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Clear golden straw yellow with off-white head. Aromas of corn, malt, wheat, a little citrus, hint of floral. Tastes of malt, corn, a little caramel, some wheat. Light body with a dry finish.

It pours light golden with a white head. The aroma features toast, grassy hops, a bit of floral hops as well. The taste is a sweet malt that features and is combined with toast and grass. It was light and smooth on the palate.
On tap at Munich brewpub. A clear pale golden with a nice white head. Flavor is cereal. Finish is strong herbal hops. Light body, average carbonation. Somewhat bland.
Flaske. Farven er klar gyldengul med en hvid fast skumkrone. Aromaen er sødlig malt og karamel medens smagen i begyndelsen er sødlig malt, der glider over i en let bitterhumlet eftersmag.

Poured from the tap at Otto’s in Willow Grove, PA. The appearance is a clear gold color with a white head. The aroma was full of malt with some yeast. The taste matched the aroma and had a very smooth palate.
Golden colour with small top. Aroma is bit sweet, some malt and caramel. Taste is light, sweet, caramel and sounds like diluted. After ... well, nothing. Drinkable, but not very often.

On Tap. @La Abadía, Gijón. 04/12/2015.
Color amarillo transparente, sabores maltosos

Bottle from Intermarche, Budens, Portugal. Very pale golden in colour with a quickly disappearing thick white head of foam. It has a sweet gentle floral fruity flavour with grassy and malty notes followed by a gentle toffee, almond and a bitter, hoppy finish. Very nice.

500ml bottle, as Spaten München. Clear yellow with small white head. Aroma is sweet light malts, white bread, cereal, grass and lemon. Taste has an initial light citrus bitterness followed by sweet light malts and dough and ending sweet with a touch of grassiness and citrus. Light mouthfeel, medium carbonation, minimal bitter aftertaste. Drinks very easily, not bad but also not very exciting.
It has an amber-golden color and has a mild flavor, perfectly combines the bitterness of hops and sweet wort with a delicate aroma of spices.
Yellow, aroma ia good, hay grassy. Taste is grassy but quite unassertive. Quaffable but very flavourless. Disappointed.
Eines der schlechteren Münchner hell, Geruch leicht metallisch auch im Geschmack, ganz leichter Hopfen, herb
Vom Fass im München. Goldgelb mit viel Schaum. Herber etwas metallischer Duft. Antrunk grob herb. Dann kommt süße. Abgang leicht säuerlich. Es gibt besseres Bier in München.

Ljus och klar. Frisk och lätt med en lätt beska. Helt okej till lite mat men saknar djup

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Oktoberfest. Full liter. Good crisp taste..................................

Pours pale golden with a white decent sized head. Mildly malty and sweetish aroma. Taste is malty and bready, but there is a nice touch of hops too. Dryish finish. Average CO2. A well balanced and enjoyable brew. (0,5 l bottle,  bb 08/2016)
Poured from 12oz bottle at home. Yellowish with white head. Smells of bread, hay, resin, basement aromas, and banana. Taste is barnyard, skunky, woody, bread, cereal. Kind of had to choke this down.
From tap. Almost clear golden color with white head. Light malty aroma, grainy. Sweet taste. Light thin body with soft carbonation.
Bottle. Clean gold with a frothy white head. Aroma is grainy malt. Flavour is malt, dough, sweet citrus base.
Clear gold. Average head with medium retention. Notes of hay and bread in the aroma, plus a bit of pear. Medium bitter. Light to medium body. Fizzy carbonation

Nice light beer, but average, i bought this one at trader joes and i guess they are a bit weak when it comes
To beer selection

roasty, basement aromas, golden, cloudy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, average carbonation, thin feel,
50 cl bottle.Pale golden colour .Hops aroma.Some sweetness and with some hoppy flavour. Light body.Dry finish.
Clear pale color with decent head. Clean, grainy aroma with a hint of sweetness. Taste is also a bit on the sweet side but gets more balanced to the finish. Decent but a bit too sweet for my taste.

Light hop aroma but moderate and herbal-earthy hop flavor. 
Light body with medium-high carbonation.
Lacks balance and too earthy, but not bad anyway.
500cc bottle. Pours clear yellow with thin white head. Malty, bready with some nice hop aroma. Really nicely brewed. Refreshing and very well balanced
Bottle. Golden color with small white head. Aroma has malt and hint of hops. Flavors of malt and some grassy hops.

Bottle - small foamy head, pale straw color, sweet corn malt aroma and flavor, mild hop bite at the end, mildly dry finish, pretty much half a step up from your standard pale lager

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap. Medium, white head. Chrystal clear golden. Malty, bit sour, fruity. Tasty and refreshing. Light bodied.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
SB Oskarshamn, flaska. Fin arom, bra beska som balanserar bra mot malten. Klarat Sauronbolagets hantering fint.

the aroma is malty and herbal with some hints of grain and hay... the taste is clear and thirst quenching, malty with smooth hoppy bitterness and some notes of herbs and grain... dry and bitter aftertaste...

Bière très mince, avec un film de mousse en surface ; nez de paille et de pommes. La bouche laisse la part belle aux céréales, et on discerne même une petite touche de houblon en fin de gorgée, mais cette helles rappelle trop une pale lager sans originalité. Pas mauvaise, quelques jolies qualités, mais au final on constate rapidement qu’il se fait mieux pour ce style.

(Flasche) Es hat eine zitronengelbe Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist etwas spelzig mit einem fruchtigen Hopfenaroma. Der Geschmack ist getreidig, Pappe und Marzipan. Bittere gibt es kaum

Color pajizo muy pálido. Un par de dedos de espuma si llega, poco duradera. Aroma muy limpio, como el aspecto. Sabor a malta de gran calidad, con cierto dulzón y algo de limón. Al final punto de sequedad final muy controlado para un conjunto muy agradable y sobre todo, extraordinariamente bebible.
Bottle found in La Paz, Bolivia. Okay white head and yellow body. Aroma of corn and hay. Flavour is citrusy hay with a medium finish. Just okay, I would hope for better from a German brew.
500ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours clear gold with a thin, short-lived white head. Aromas of grass and lemon, light pale malt. Taste is light malt, bready too. Light sweet finish.

Gezapft getrunken. 
Extrem langweiliges Bier. Schmeckt nach Wasser mit klein wenig Hopfenbittere.
Mehr kann man dazu absolut nicht schreiben.
Bottle from Glug Newcastle. Pours light gold, thin dissipating head. Bready, faintly sweet flavour. Quite nice

500ml on tap at Bavarian Beer cafe, Moore Park (before Roosters game). Sweet malt nose. Pale yellow beer with small diminishing white head. Spritzy mineral water feel. A little bitter at first then malt takes over. Finish is a little too sweet but it’s over quickly. Designed to be consumed quickly and often.

El carbónico fluye constante, cubriendo todos los espacios del vaso, que se llena de un amarillo cálido, transparente y ligero.
Aroma fuerte, un poco asomagado, contenido, como si el contacto con el aire no le hiciera muy bien para expresarse, pero que aún así le otorga una leve percepción de madera. Quizás eso explique esa sensación que queda en la nariz.
Ligera y de poco carácter en boca, no se muestra en sabor y queda un tanto insípida, como si algo le faltara para demostrar su personalidad.
Pasa como una industrial más, aunque se nota que su factura es de mejor calidad. Ligera y suave, la Spaten es de esas cervezas para beber tranquilamente, disfrutándola sabiendo que no puede ofrecer algo más que el buen gusto para calmar la sed.
A typical example of Munich brew. Thin non saying, below average beer just come from here...
On draft and in bottles years ago..well balanced..crisp,dry with decent hops..not bad.

Malty, with a very short bitter bite on your tongue in the middle. Eases into a taste of hay and hops, but it’s somehow just really brief. Like you might want to taste more of it but then it’s already gone. Still, a fairly enjoyable lager, for sure.

Pours light yellow with skimpy white head. Strong grassy aroma with notes of DMS. Taste is bland with dry aftertaste, minimally bitter. Light mouthfeel with ample carbonation. Overall tastes like cheap beer fit for resuscitation of the masses. Goes down easily and best consumed cold, which isn't a compliment. Won't buy again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear golden yellow, short lasting white foam head. Typical taste for a German beer. OK, not outstanding. (Velp 201503)
On tap at Anable Basin Sailing Bar & Grill, New York. Pale golden, small white head. Light body, sweetish. Malty and grainy. Below average. Light bitterness in the end.

Light gold, white head. Malt aroma, grains, hay. Taste again sweetish Munich malt, grainy, grass and hay. Low amount of bitterness. Light to medium body. Nothing spectacular but very nicely done and hits the spot every time. 

Should not have tried it again... Nostalgia is a damnable thing.

Bottle
Aroma-malty, grass
Appearance-pale, clear, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-light body, thin feel, lively, bitter finish
Overall-very refreshing
500ml bottle, 5.2%. Pours clear golden with a white head that doesn’t last. Refreshing barley malt flavoured beer. Half decent but nothing original about it. Fairly average lager

500ml Bottle from Reilly’s (Lisnaskea - £1.79):

Quite a nice lager without really doing much to stand out from the crowd, being from Germany is almost enough to elevate it above most lagers you’re likely to try in the UK but it is by no means a classic. It had enough going for it to keep you interested and the crisp finish was particularly pleasing but it’s not a beer I’d go out of my way to track down again.
Bottle. Pale yellow with a medium white foam. Maly and grassy tones. Malt, grass, hops and vegetables. Medium body with a balanced finish.
Decently balanced beer. Golden yellow color with a smooth finish. Worth a taste if you are interested in trying a new German beer but nothing significant to brag about with this offering.

Wygląd pełny, klarowny, barwa złota, piana obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, nietrwała. W zapachu trochę drożdży, trochę chmielu, mało wyrazisty. W smaku lekko ziołowy, całkiem niezła goryczka, nie zalega, na języku szerokie. Po kilku chwilach aromat się ulotnił.

bottle @ Party Source / Bellevue KY --- Clear golden amber with a full white head cover, short strips of lace. Aroma of hops and grass. Taste is slightly sweet malt that is countered on the swallow by assertive floral hops. Malt and hops share a medium finish. Clean and refreshing.

Pours mostly clear yellow with fizzy white head. Aroma is pale malts, faint toast, faint corn, and faint floral notes. Flavor is dry malts, faint hops, and faint fruit esters; dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.
From the tap at Speiselokal Lens in Munich. Pours with a cola-like transparency and a decent head. Tastes great, all in all a great beer to have at lunch.

Comes out of the tap clear Amber with a thin ivory head. Crisp, malty aroma is a little fruity. Flavor is a little better, crisp and malty with more apple tone. Mouthfeel is not too fizzy, but fairly firm. OK - have it with a meal.
Butelka. Kolor jasno bursztynowy, klarowne. Piana obfita. W aromacie wyczuwalne nuty słodowe. W smaku lekko słodkawe i z lekką goryczka.

Ladna piana, czysty profil, brak goryczki, aromaty i smaki slodowe, wrecz miodowe momentami. Nie moja bajka, ale zarazem krzywdy na pewno nikomu to piwo nie zrobilo 

Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

pours a clear straw yellow with a quickly dissipating bubbly white head. Aroma is classic Euro lager grass and skunk. Taste is bright and then sweet. Well balanced. Modest hop presence with a pleasant finish. Not a bad beer.  Similar to Beck’s or Grolsch.

30 October 2020: 500ml bottle. Pours clear gold with a medium-sized white head that lasts for a couple of minutes. Aroma is malt, bread, and grass. Taste is light to medium sweet, bread, malt. Light, pleasant bitter finish. I can appreciate a decent lager these days. 7/3/7/3/13= 3.3

7 December 2014: 500ml bottle. Pours straw colour with a small white head that fizzes away in seconds. Aroma is grass and malts. Sweet taste with a slightly bitter finish. I had wanted to try this for a long time, but it turned out to be quite a boring beer really. 5/2/5/2/12 = 2.6

500ml can from the Beer Store
pours a very pale clear yellow small head no lacing
smells like sweet corn
and tastes the same

50cl. Bottle. 

Pours clear pale yellow with white head. 

Aroma grass, malts, biscuit. 

Taste nice balanced bitter sweet. 

Mouthfeel thin. 

Nice brew.
Very pale. Moderate aroma, light sweet malts, bit of white bread like. Uninteresting. Taste is better, very smooth and easy drinkable. Not bitter enough for me though. (50cl bottle from V&B Tours)

Bottle.

A: Translucent gold with a big foamy head which settles into a fluff. Picture worthy.

N: Corn, grist, earth, sweet biscuit, herbaceousness,

T: Sweet, watery, clean.

M: Very light, fuzzy carbonation, no alcohol.

O: Boring and yet tasty and reminiscent of past days. I love the easy drinking lyfe.

Bottle as premium lager from Jusco on sale at 250 yen (best before 12/2014). Upon opening and serving in a lager glass it pour a very pale gold with a thin soapy white head. Alas it was lightstruck with one of the skunkiest aromas I’ve smelled in awhile(why do they use green bottles?), once you get past that you get a grainy sweet pale malt aroma with possibly a hint of residual hoppiness. On the palate it is light, sharp and crisp with a dry finish. The taste is dusty dry crackers, a bit of sweetness then a bitter skunky finish with somewhat of a sour aftertaste. It’s obviously gone off but I am guessing fresh on a hot day it would be a passable lager(probable 3-3.1).
Buona birra. Nella media dello stile. Molto beverina grazie alla buona consistenza del corpo
On draft. Golden color with thin head. Malty aroma. Malty and grassy taste. A simple beer, but good.

"not bad...a good food/pizza beer, but nothing so special that it’s a treat on it’s own. clean, crisp, and well balanced...just a hair under where it rate Spaten pils...malty flavor, hop finish. refreshing."

Tap (in Garmisch); clear gold pour with a white head; aroma of malt and hops; taste is bittersweet with malt and hops with a hint of citrus, has a light bitter finish; not bad but Spaten has better beers.
Clear light gold pour with lively white head. PIls like aroma and straw/hay with a hint of something doughy. A bit of that sweet dough on the uptake but really this is a quaffer. Not for me.
On tap. Clear golden with white head. Smell is light grain. Taste is light grain malty with biscuits and hay finish is slightly bitter. Balanced. Dry with low bitterness and high carbonation.
Golden color with white head. Malty aroma. Taste more sweet then bitter, light but really ok. Pretty good lager.

500 ml bottle. Golden yellow, perfectly clear, with a small, creamy, not too persistent bright white head Pretty invinting and fresh nose. Bread/pale malts, light vanilla, wet hay, floral and grassy hop notes. Slightly nutty and toasted as well. Sweet and sugary upfront, almost sirupy and honey like, pretty harsh bitterness which doesn’t linger too much. Malty and slightly dusty aftertaste. Light mineral presence as well. Average to lively carbonation, light to medium body, slightly creamy texture. Not bad.

Aroma: hay, bread; Appearance: clear urine, minimal head; Taste: slight bitterness, medium sweetness, slight sourness; Palate: fizzy carbonation, abrupt finish, light body, slick texture

A nice helles but without awe.
16 oz draft pours golden with a white head. Aroma of grain, malts and biscuits. Taste is malts, herbal and toffee.
Pours pale yellow/gold with a thin white head. Aroma hints at malt. Hints of toffee, biscuit malt in the flavor with some creaminess. A light but surprisingly good lager.

This looks, smells and tastes like beer. Really not much more to say here. Typical lager all around. Grain and slightly spicy dryness. Not enough of the latter to be crisp or refreshing. Blah but not terrible.
Bottle, 50 cl, Biztron, Uppsala. Overall nice lager, well-balanced, nice golden colour.

Cannette 500 ml. 5.2%. Couleur jaune or, mousse blanche.Arôme de grains et un peu de houblon. En bouche, douce et croustillante. Notes de pain, un peu d’herbe et céréales. Finale sans histoire. Bonne bière de soif quand il faut chaud.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Light bready malty smell. Clean smell. The taste is similar but a bit more artificial. Better then your average industrial lager.

Bottle. Clear straw golden with a decent creamy head. Aroma - pale malt, yeast and some herbal notes. Sweetish with grains, malty and grassy hops flavors, low bitterness. A bit too fizzy and not crispy enough. So-so.
Clear straw yellow color with very little head. Aroma is grains and malt. Taste is same as aroma. Very nice lager taste. The taste is a little on the light side, I wish the taste jumped out more.
Hazysh golden color, average sized white head. Medium body, high carbonation. Aroma of malt and yeast, traces of hops. Light sweet taste. As boring as it gets.

Bottle to shaker glass. Pours clear yellow/golden, quick head, some lacing. Aroma of hay, slightly lemony, a little skunk. Taste is mostly sweet with a touch of bitterness. Light body, medium carbonation, thin mouth feel. Finishes dry, malty sweet, notes of skunk. Average.
Tämä pitää hotalehtaa. Suureen janoon ja pieneen nautintoon. Tätä ei maistella vaan juodaan. Edit. Pettymysmaku.

Tap. Pours mostly clear yellow with fizzy white head. Aroma is pale malts, faint toast, faint corn, and faint floral notes. Flavor is dry malts, faint hops, and faint fruit esters; dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

Draft at Bowie Baysox game. Pours clear bright gold with a fizzy white head. Tastes like dry cracker malt, musky corn, sweet vegetable. Light bot and low carbonation. Smells like sweet corn and musky malt.

Bottle. Golden, clear with head reduced to ring.
Aroma: Almost nothing, minimal DMS.
Taste: Low sweetness with low bitter contrary. Flavor contains some hoppy herbs, some grain. High carbonation for better refreshing. Quite drinkable but also quite "nothing beer".
Distinctively hoppy with medium-low bitterness and slight malt breadiness. Somewhat forgettable.

Review according to BJCP2008 guidelines (style 1D). Bottle 50 cl - Batch 17.02.2104. AROMA: sweet malt aroma with a slight background DMS. low hop aroma. APPEARANCE: yellow clear with a thin white head with average retention. TASTE: sweet taste that lingers into the finish. low bitterness and low hop flavour. no esters. PALATE: médium-light body, medium-low carbonation. OVERALL: an average bulk munich helles and the original style created at Spaten brewery.

Keg - Bavarian Bier Cafe, Manly, Sydney. Poured a clear, bright golden with a lasting one-finger white head. Aromas of lemon, some grain and a gentle toast and biscuit malt character. Very crisp, clean and with refreshing purity. Light to medium body, medium carbonation with a fine length of a soft intensity bitterness. Gentle, easy-drinking with fair bittersweet balance.

Clear golden with a fairly big quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is light grains, pale malt, seed, touch of bitter hops. Taste is clean with simple pale malt, barley and cooked vegetables. Some bitter grassy hops. Finishes dry and wattery. Light to medium body, medium carbo, slight dry and crisp texture. Refreshing.
Golden, clear beer with a white foam. Quite mild malty aroma. Watery body. No bitterness. Malty sweet. Very simple but still refreshing.
Mycket god pilsner. Smakar som urtypen av en öl. Härlig skumkrona och vacker färg. Världsklass.
faint malt aroma. light golden and clear with a nice head. taste is very light with a slight malt flavor. beer is watery.

Bottle 50cc at Guldhedens rest. 
Mostly barley in the nose. Malty. Very lightly hopped. Nice lager. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a clear golden color with white head. Cereal grains mostly on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with more grain. One-dimensional.

It has a light golden colored body with very good clarity and some visible streams of carbonation. The head on top is light and foamy, bright white in color and fades out quickly. The aroma is very light with just a hint of pale malt and grassy/floral hop notes. The flavor is simple crisp and refreshing with a light to medium body. There is a thin biscuity malt balanced by floral and somewhat grassy hops that bring mild but balanced bitterness. The finish is quick and fairly dry with active cleansing carbonation.

500 ml bottle, bottled 14/5 2014, bought at Systembolaget
Crisp, dry and clear with a malty and sweetish finish. Nicely carbonated where the foam quickly disintegrates and leaves a small lace at the rim.
Pilsner'ish smell of dough and cooked vegetables.
Overall: Easy drinking thirst quencher on a hot day, still a distinctive Munchener/Helles feel and taste. A good option to the usual macro pilseners

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared a 50cl bottle. Pours a clear golden colour with a small white head. Aroma is malt, hay and hops. Average carbonation and light body. Taste is slightly more sweet than bitter with some hops at finish. Overall, an average beer, drinkable but not remarkable.

Aroma of grains, dust, and some malt. Well balanced with a prominent bitterness that balances the flavors of malt, grains, cereal, slight sulfur and a teeny amount of diacetyl. Not too bad, but not too good either.

Bottle aquired at some random systembolag

Golden clear, big white head. Smell of dust, spices, some cooked vegetables. Light sweet, super dry, very crisp and super clean. Finish of with a moderate bitter finish. Totally not very exciting, but helles has never been the most interesting style by default
Geel bier met schuim. Smaak is gemiddeld bitter en niet zoet. Blijft redelijk lang hangen. Goed bier.

Pretty good for the style. A nice, foamy, inch of white caps the glass. Very bread dough like aroma comes off the golden liquid, with just a hint of honey. Very malt forward flavour dominated by breadiness, that has a touch of sweetness to it. The mouth feel is fairly smooth with low carbonation. There isn’t much of a finish with this one either.
Pored very clear light gold color, little to no carbonation and medium head. Tastes like a typical helles only somewhat smother.
Bottle from notes. Pours a clear golden color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor have sweet grainy malts, corn, hay, dry bread light herbal notes, pretty basic stuff.
Tap at Black Door, Helsinki. Originally rated 2011. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, sweetness and malts.

Botella de 500ml. Vaso Pokal. Color dorado pálido y apariencia cristalina. Espuma blanca con corona discreta que deja una fina y persistente capa en la superficie y algunos encajes en las paredes. Levadura, leve sulfuro, notas florales, trazos cítricos y toque de galleta en nariz. Entrada malteada con sabor de grano y dulzor ligero. Cuerpo intenso a medio y carbonatación moderada-alta. Textura densa algo aguada. Limpio amargor de piel de limón y paladar reseco, pero el malteado –que presenta sabor de galleta- aflora y equilibra un prolongado y gentil final amargo. Recuerdos de zumo de limón en el retrogusto. 500ml bottle. Pokal glass. Pale golden color, clear appearance. White froth, close but discrete crown leaves a thin lasting layer on top & some lacing on sides. Yeast, slight sulfur, floral, citric hints & biscuit touch to the nose. Malty upfront, light sweet & grainy flavor. High to medium body. Moderate to high carbonation. Oily to watery texture. Clean lemon zest-like bitterness & dried mouthfeel but maltiness –shown as a biscuit flavor- arises & balances a long gentle bitter finish. Lemon juice memories on the aftertaste.

12 oz bottle poured into a shaker. The aroma starts out with a prevalent banana and clove note, which fades and is replaced by something more yeast-like, maybe toasted bread too. As the drink settles, a slight mildew and wet leather start to come through. The beer is a clear, pale straw color with a light, bubbly head that reduces to a thin, but present, layer and leaves a light lacing. The taste is a medium high sweetness with a light bitterness. It’s a light bodied beer with a creamy and smooth texture and a light, fuzzy carbonation. The initial flavors that strike the tongue are honey, and caramel, both with a mellow presence. This is accompanied by a light grass note, a mild, sweet lemon, and a very faint spice. The finish is crisp, with a mellow spicy hop bite. The aftertaste is floral, bread, and spice, but it’s a light aftertaste the fades at a moderate pace.

12 oz bottle into a Samuel Smith pint glass.

A: Pours a crystal clear golden straw color. I love how translucent the body is, in particular. The head is a two finger white shade; retention isn’t the best, but there’s some really nice lacing left on the glass.

S: Aye, it’s a bit skunked (lol, green bottles), but it could have been worse. The notes of pale malts, faint sweetness, and zesty hops aren’t dulled in any significant capacity.

T: At first, some of the hop profile comes through with notes of grass and lemon zest, but the finish is pure, balanced, simple malt goodness. In particular, it has a nutty flavor that I really enjoy (that, and the diacetyl is kept in check). Personally, I want more hops; but I won’t complain about the balance this offers.

M: Not quite as bone dry as I like my lagers to be - nor is it too sweet. The texture does the best it can to provide good drinkability without significant hoppiness.

O: Green bottles mean I wouldn’t buy this one again. However, I would seek it out on tap. An under-appreciated lager unfortunately scorned both by its bottle color and by who makes it.

Canette 500ml sous le nom de "Spaten München". De couleur jaune-dorée et claire. Nez de grains de malt pâle légèrement sucré, léger de houblon hebreux aux notes florales avec des traces de miel. Mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi qu’une texture légèrement aqueuse. Goût de grains de malt pâle légèrement sucrés et aux petites notes croustillantes dès l’entrée en bouche auquel se rajoute des notes de miel et quelques traces de pain puis en finale l’on retrouve une légère amertume de houblon herbeux (gazon) aux notes florales. Post-goût court aux notes sèches, aux petites notes amères de houblon herbeux.

Si presenta di colore giallo paglierino, omogeneo. Corpo vivido e limpido, lascia trasparire una flebile fermentazione interna.

La schiuma è bassa, con superficie sporca. Morbida, compatta lungo i bordi, si caratterizza per un’elevata persistenza ed un colore bianco sporco.

L’aroma è immediatamente luppolato, dai chiari sentori erbacei, freschi, cui seguono una traccia di frutta dolce (banana), alcol, malto, spezie.

Il gusto evidenzia un corpo rotondo e consistente, con rapido passaggio dall’imbocco all’ingoio, lasciando comunque la bocca piacevolmente "piena". Forte la persistenza amarostica (tra le più alte delle Premium sinora bevute). Finale con punta amara, cede rapidamente il passo dopo l’ingoio, lasciando una prolungata nota amara in bocca. Si richiamano le note percepite al naso: erbacei del luppolo, punta lievemente alcolica, malto biscotto. Manca in bocca la componente dolce e fruttata percepita al naso, costituendo così un corpo profondamente secco e amaro. Buona carbonazione, beverinità messa a dura prova dalla profonda e persistente amarosticità e secchezza, che non la rendono dissetante. Sul finale la birra perde in rotondità, attenuando la componente amara.

Buono e complessivamente pulito il naso, troppo intenso sotto il profilo amarostico il gusto. La mancanza di un contrappeso alla carica luppolata la rendono amara al punto da rendere la gola arsa, bisognosa di qualcosa di più fresco.
Transparent light gold pour.  Lasting white head.  Aroma of spicy hop and a little white grape.  Taste is slightly sweet up front with a slightly spicy and bitter finish.

50cl bottle. Nice hay like color and small white head which leaves no lacing. Some bitterness and pretty sweet taste with some sourness. Hay, bread and nice malts and hops. Still, taste is too short and not too balanced.

Fresh, cool aroma.  Bread, hay, and some yeast funk.  Not a great one.  Taste just like it smells.  High carbonation.  Overall, this one isn’t that great.  The first time I have been let down by a Munchen lager.
Uppfriskande- men smakar som vilken annan lager som helst. God törstsläckare men inte mer.

Splendid and sparkling yellow gold with a loose two inch bob of white atop that  lasts and laces a thick weave. Sulphury, vegetal pils malt dominated nose that is salty and mineral-like. There is a touch of toasted grains and dusty Noble hops. Bulk load of dusty malt  on the palate with a sweet citrusy front and sour malt back end. Hops are peppery but reserved and only kick in late into the mildly bitter swallow. A touch of white grapes and tart berries in there is odd for a Helles. Light bodied but filling in end and chalky long into drinking. Not the most sessionable of lagers, let alone it’s desired style. Average!  (50cL, BB 04/06/13, Cellarbrations Carlisle)

A very nice representation of the style, Spaten Lager pours clear golden with a fleeting head.  A nice sweetness with a tiny touch of hop bitterness are rounded out by flavors of bread and biscuit.  

Make no mistake, no beer of this style is going to blow your socks off, but this is great for what it is, an easy drinking beer that is great cold in a big liter mug.  Take note though: the ABV is a little higher than a typical session beer, so if you’re using this for an all-day drinkfest, you might catch a little more of a buzz than anticipated.
Tap @ CPH Airport. Pours clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma of malt, grain, hay.  Flavour is malt, grain, honeylike sweetness, grass, hay. Medium body, lively carbonation. 280912

Aroma is barnyardish. A clear yellow pour with a mostly diminishing head and no lacing. Taste is floral with some grain notes and a metallic finish. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. Overall, not overwhelming.

From a 500ml bottle on 23/9/2012. Pours a very clear light golden with almost no head. Has a bready, malty aroma. Sweet bready and biscuity malt are the most prominent flavours, with a touch of honey and spice in the mix. The hops are gentle, the body light, and the carbonation average. This is a superior lager style beer, which is quite refreshing, and has a reasonable amount of character and flavour.
Bottle. Very light head, poor in aroma. Classic lager, nothing much to say. I don’t recommend it.

Bottle@home, 50cl. Head:white colored foam. Color: yellow golden. Aroma: vague hops, malt. Taste: some bitter, a little malt. Palate: smooth, medium body, low CO2, medium bitter finish. Overall: nice.

0,5 l bottle.   Best before 08/2013 
hay, cereal, citrus, herbs, grass, leaves, golden, clear, rocky head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, average carbonation,
Bottle pour to pilsener glass.  Clear, pale yellow; light carbonation.  Crisp, light taste. Could probably drink all day.
Fat O'Learys Örebro. Klar gyllengul vätska. Bördig och lätt i både doft och smak. Stabil med diskreta humletoner
Very crisp light and bubbly brew. Foamy head and a pure golden color. A very nice session beer.
Hazy pale yellow colour. Small white head. Mildly flowery and grassy hop flavour. Refreshing.
It’s warm golden with a creamy head. The aroma malt, bread and flower. The flavor has a light sweetness and notes of malt, bread, fruit and light straw. The finish is dry. Really nice.

La cerveza más agradable que conozco para beber, de la cual puedes beber litros y litros sin sentir cansancio por la misma. No se caracteriza por un gran aroma, y su sabor no lo puedo definir entre los mejores, pero es fantástica.

12oz bottle. Clear golden color. Good, thin white head, that persists. Little lace. Good, smooth texture. Dry finish. Light sweet taste. Light hops to the general lightly salty bready lager taste. Another alright german lager.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Very light head, poor in aroma. Flavour of straw and hay. Quite bitter.

0,5 l bottle shared with McTapps. A mediocre Helles which is just better than the Hacker and way worse than the contender from Paulaner. A bit bitter, a bit quaff, nice light golden colour. Good beer, but not very good.
Draft. Pours yellow fluffy white head smells a bit sweet a little bitter beck taste. Not bad not great.
Pours a clear, pale gold with an ample white head and a mild aroma.  Slightly malty.  A nice, simple lager.  Nothing special, but a reliable German beer that is fairly tasty and easy to drink.
@ Monks Sveavägen. Yellow colour with a large white head. Sweet aroma. Malty flavour with some bitterness.
Buen sabor. Bastante floja pero con una espuma de buen tacto. Olor bueno. Muy rubia y clara de apariencia. Buena cerveza. Nivel medio de alcohol.
Bottle Pours out golden topped with a white head. Aroma of caramel, light floral notes, and some sweetness. Taste was sweet malts, grass, and some light bitterness on the end.
Bottle to pint.  Looks fine; like a lager.  Smells and tastes pretty bland, but decent.  Average on the palate.  Meh.

330ml bottle pours a pale golden color with a 2 finger white head that dissipates quickly leaving some spotty lacing on the glass.  Aroma is light cereal grains and some grassy notes.  Taste is malty sweet with a hint of light fruit and a grassy hop bitterness.  Light bodied with nice carbonation providing a decent mouthfeel.  Quite a refreshing lager and recommended for some session drinking.

Aroma: caramel, floral, Appearance: golden, clear, minimal head, Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, Palate: full body, creamy, average carbonation, astringent. 5 L mini-keg A welcome contrast to the pilsners recently reviewed with its less bitterness and greater sweetness.

12 ounce bottle as Premium.  Pours a golden yellow with a thin white head that fades quickly.  Taste is of malt, grass, hay and some hops.  Is slightly sweet.  Has a nice grass and hay aroma.  The body is on the light side and has some light bitterness and dryness to it.  Easy to drink and enjoyable, but kind of forgettable.

Got the green bottle version, which of course led to some regrettable skunking out of the bottle.  Once poured into the glass, the aroma was cleaner, crisper, and grassier, if a little faint.  Pretty big head, decent lacing, and goldish yellow color.  Nice balance of semi-sweet malt and residual hops - smooth, drinkable, and yet quite flavorful.  Though I prefer ales, a nice refreshing lager is good every once in awhile, and Spaten’s dortmunder fits this bill.
The head is medium, it smells sweet, a bit citrus-sweet. The taste is malty, watery, just a bit sweet, very mild. Drinkable 9/8/8/8/8/8

On tap at German/American Club, Louisville. Aroma and flavor dominated by hay and citrus; some herbal hops in the finish. Body was gold with foamy white head. Palate was bubbly and soft. Run of the mill, but not a bad mill.
On tap. Malty and sweet aromas, some herbal. Pours pale gold, wih vanishing white head, no lacing. Light body and carbonation. Taste is malty,sweet, some citric. Short sweet finish.
On tap. Aroma is light hopy, citrus. Appearance is golden with a finger thick head. Taste is slightly sour and light bitter. Has lively carbonation, a light bitter short finish. Nice beer.

Can. Somewhat present German hops. Mildly acidic. Metallic mouthfeel. Corn finish. Maintains that classic German pilsener taste, which makes it passable, but it tasted like it came out of factory. I think the can may have sullied things a bit, so a re-rate candidate for sure.
Draft at Moriartys. Gold pour with a small  foamy white head. Light dry citrus hops. Very clean and crisp. Mild but pleasant fizzy hop bite from start to finish. Refreshing.

Originally reviewed: 11/6/08. Pours a crystal clear straw gold. Good amount of bubbles rising from the bottom. Large 2-finger foamy white head. Pretty good retention, and so-so lacing. 

Smells pretty astringent. Some corn scents coming through, mixed with some of the floral hops scent.

This tastes like a lager, albeit a good lager. There’s nothing here that’s that unique. Low hop bitterness. Nice malt backbone. Starts with a slight metallic twang that fades after the first few sips. 

Crisp clean brew. Decent amount of carbonation. High drinkable quality, but I’d move on to more flavorful beers after this.

Bottle, pours yellow-gold with a full white head with medium staying power. Good lacing. Aroma is light, with both floral hops and a bready malt. Flavor is malty, a little sweet. Refreshing and has good carbonation and a clean finish.

Bought bottle at Systembolaget Gårda Gøteborg
Light golden color, good foam
Light body & light to medium complexity.
Well balanced
Ok light kind of beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Yellow pour with a white soapy head. Grain elements and slightly sweet. Okay.
Smells very good. Golden color and a heavy taste. A aftertaste that laste long after you are finsih drinking it.

Draught.  Pours clear pale yellow and gold with a small white head.  Aromas of straw and millet, some caramel, and light sweetness.  The flavor is watery straw and some alcohol, surprisingly sweet, almost as if sugar had been added.  Meh.  [1033]

Can from the LCBO (Spaten München Original Munich beer). Pours a pale golden colour with a frothy white head that stays a long time, foaming over the brew (3mm) and creating thick streams of lacing. Mild aromas and seems more like corn than grain malt. Light-bodied with medium carbonation. Malty taste with a bit of hop, just balancing the flavours, very slight adding some grass (but no bitterness). Not much sweetness, just a little grainy, but overall pretty boring (not impressed by feeling corn instead of grain malt).

Style et résumé: Münchener helles (premium lager blonde de Munich).  


Comment: Canette de 500ml achetée en Ontario, merci Vincent. 


Description: Bière jaune claire avec une mousse blanche qui a une belle tenue. Le nez est frais, nous invitant à boire le liquide à grande lampée. Il y a du grain et une légère touche de houblon. La bouche est un de peu plus facile, légère, mince, aqueuse, un vrai étancheur de soif. Elle n’a aucun arrière goût.  


Note:  3/10
Sweet taste at finish.  Appearance of a hard cider almost.  Not very good though.  Spaten is known for its optimator.

Usual brown 500ml bottle, labelled as the Munchner Hell. Best before Mar 2012, poured into two pilsner stemmed tulips.

The beer was reviewed in a blind tasting along side the Spaten Pils in Oct 2011: this beer was slightly dark in its golden colour and smoother, meaning softer and so bitter as the Pils.

Looks good, as already stated it is a good rich gold colour, a thin white head tried to hang around, but like all beers I’ve had in this style, it failed to stay for long.

No real smell, gets my usual score of 3 for a non-smelling pilsner/lager/helles.

Although there is a hop feel to it, its not harsh or too bitter (like its Pilsner brother).

Easy to drink and I could see myself drinking this sort of brew on a hot summers day in a Munich bier garden.
Pours clear golden with a normal head. Aroma hay, grass, bread, butter. Low palate. Very all round basic german pale lager.

(50 cl partagée par rodenbach99)  Une robe bien estivale avec sa teinte jaune pâle.  Une belle tête mousseuse qui laisse une dentelle.  Un nez de grains légèrement sulfurés qui se laissent atteindre par une timide douceur mielleuse.  Un goût très léger dans lequel les grains sont perceptibles et les houblons pratiquement absents.  Une bouche très peu dense.  Une effervescence spectaculaire.  Une texture qui n’est pas tout à fait aqueuse.  Une finale qui n’existe que dans une autre vie.  Tout compte fait, meilleur que certaines bières légères populaires.
Bottled. Pours pale yellow with a huge head. Smells boiled vegetables and malt. Tastes abit sweet and malty with a bitter finish.

I used to drink this fairly often ten or so years ago.  Clear and light with dissipating head. Smells lightly skunky and a bit like chrysanthemums plus sweet. Tastes sweet and a little watery. Very light.
This pours a nice golden color with minimal head. The taste is sweet and grainy. Definately has the bitter beer smell and after taste.
Straw yellow, tight white head that does not stay long.  Medium malt and a dry hop nose.  Solid malt through the middle with a clean finish.  Good benchmark; malty, clean lager.

Ze Germans have produced a 5.2% beer with phenomenal taste. It’s a great summer beer that you can drink again and again and again. And again. It’s refreshing, crisp, and really enjoyable. In fact, if I were a car, I’d insist I be refilled with this every 4 months or 3000 kilometres.

Poured a light golden color with minimal head, had a rather typical lager color with a slight skunkiness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Apearance was  clear golden pale diminsihing 1 finger creamy white head, slight lacing. Sweet biscuity malts, hops are herbal and spicey.Yeasts are floral and sourish with funky slight skunky smell. Taste are sweet caramel hints with hops mellowed out and citrusy floral slight grassy tartish to them. Palate is smooth creamy carbonation with meduim average length,slight warmth and dryish finish.Unique beer...

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear pale golden with a big frothy white head. Aroma of grassy hops and some yeasty notes. Taste is medium dry, well carbonated, spicy hops, light in taste and mouthfeel, still a very good balanced helles.

On tap poured into a pint glass

A: light straw yellow color, foamy 1/2 head, quick reduction to light lacing cap

S: light malt, slight grass.

T: light malt balanced well with flower and grass hop

M&d:light mouth, slightly buttery
Bottle from Alcampo. Clear golden colour, medium white head. Nose is grassy hops, bit of bread. Flavour is light bitter, fruity, bit grainy and grassy. Slightly dry finish.

(Tap) Clear straw colour, good head. Aroma has hints of bread and spice. Palate is light and fizzy. Flavour has some not terribly pleasant grassy metallic aspects and is rather watery. Overall drinkable, but really just a bit bit up above average / acceptable.
50 cl can from LCBO. Pours a clear golden colour with small foamy head. Nothing to get carried away, but enjoyable.

Sorry for the german rating, but this is a lousy rating from my "newbie" time (2007-2009), and it’s not worth of being translated. I just added it for the statistics, and to complete my backlog!


Also von Aussen sieht das Spaten jetz nicht sonderlich interessant aus. Aber mal schaun was drinsteckt. Geruchlich kommts mit ner gewissen Würzigkeit daher. Ebenso der Antrunk. Feinwürzig und malzig, im Abgang leicht herb und hopfig. Man kanns gut trinken, ein Bier ohne Höhen und Tiefen…
color paglierino chiaro. Schiuma abbondante che va scomparendo quasi immediatamente. Gusto maltato leggero. Non proprio consigliata.
Pours into a nice foamy head with a consistent carbonation.  A nice medium hops flavor with a smooth finish.

50 cl bottle, 0.90€. Clear pale gold beer, wobbly white head. Light nose of hops, almost absent. Mouthful of grains and lager malts, some yeast and a bit of metal. Starts sweet with a light bitterness in the finish. Average carbonation, medium to full bodied, slightly oily texture, thick feel. Heavy helles, sadly uninteresting.

Pours golden with a thin white head.  Hoppy with malty sweetness. Not much else to report really. Above average pilsner.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle from el corte ingles, lisbon, portugal. Golden. Low to medium bitterness. Thin to med smooth head. Medium to high carbonation. Nice barley malt aroma.

Couple pints at Capital Club 16, Raleigh. Nice joint too. It’d been quite a long time since I’d had this brew, and the clean, bright hops went well with the grub. Abundant fizzy carbonation, and a bright golden brew. Mouthfeel went a bit flattish despite the apparent liveliness. And while the nose was clean and dry with dashes of fruit and malts, the taste blanded up a touch as well. Still decent if a bit anonymous but there are far superior Helles out there.
Bottle 500ml. Color yellow with medium white head. Aroma yeast, hop. Taste sweet, dry, bitter.
Pours a golden yellow with a white head and aroma of malts. Taste is of grain and malts with a quick, crisp finish. Light brew that is very drinkable.

Pours a clear golden color. Very light, sweet and watery. Better than most macro American lagers, but still lacking any real flavor. Probably great on a
hot thirsty day, since it is rather very easy to drink without any finish.
Flaska 50 cl. En högst ordinär lager med svaga dofter av gräs och inte mycket starkare smaker av detsamma, samt en viss knäckighet. Snyggt skum dock.

I try this beer with illusion, so I hoped to find some diffenrent from Spanish industrial lager beers. One of the most populars beers in Oktoberfest became the same that Spanish lagers. Golden colour, good head and nothing special. Just pass!
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Mild malt and hopp aroma. Medium sweet malt flavour with some hoppy notes.

Bottle @ home. Green bottle picked up in Colorado, so who knows how long it’s been deteriorating under the fluorescent lights. Clear, golden appearance with a white head. Grainy, grassy, hay, straw, a touch skunked, dull floral aroma. Crisp, a little bit sweet pale malty, straw, hay, grassy/floral hoppy flavor. Easy drinking and better than I remembered. Pretty decent Helles.

Draft at Milwaukee Brat House.  Pale, filtered green tinted yellow.  Steady creamy white head.  Crisp up front leads to a straightforward lager malt body.
