Poured a vibrant golden color into my large stein with a nice, large white head.  Flavor of crisp grain.  Very refreshing and drinkable lager especially on a warm day.

(cleaning out my beer bottle collection as pictured in my profile and utilizing ratebeer.com)
As I recall, it was a nice full-bodied lager, almost pilsner in style.  Crips and grainy in flavor.
clear gold with little lacing and a small head.  crisp palate.  grains, corn flakes in aroma and flavor.
Soft fruit on the nose, almost a little nutmeg.  Yellow-gold color with a hint of orange.  Sweet honey with well-rounded bitterness.  Medium body, with a fruity sweet finish.  A great Helles.
Not much to comment on really.  A fairly basic beer.  Golden colour with a thin malty flavour and not much aroma.
botlle, claer and golden.  Hay, grass, sweet and bitter, a nice balance.  Would go well with a salami and cheese sandwich, extra mustard. Very good lager.
this is my summer beer good with brazilian barbaque that i do every weekend
On tap:  Clear and clean throughout.  The hops were apparent with a floral overtone in the nose and a bitter finish.
Draught. Hop nose. Clear pale colour. Decent head. Clean taste, good finish.What you would expect from a German brew............ No a mass.

The aroma is of hops, honey, and a hint of wildflowers, and the taste is exceptionally clean with malt and honey characteristics.  This beer goes down amazingly smooth and is very refreshing.  A top flight lager.
Looks refreshing with a generous head and golden color.  Light clean crisp taste.  A classic look and smell.
Golden yellow color with a good sized white head. Malty aroma. flavors are malt and biscuit with a slight lemon zest.
Pours a crystal clear pale yellow with a large white head. Was a nice beer. Not as fond of the Lagers as I once was but tastes change.

12 ounce bottle in pint glass.  Clear golden yellow with lasting ring.  Honey lemon aroma.  Mild honey sweetness with dry medium bitter finish.  Medium-light body, medium carbo.  Something in the flavor throws me.  Pretty good, just, I dunno, I don’t like it as much as some of the other sweeter lagers, I guess.
Inviting gold appearance. low carbonation with a very pleasant maltiness that doesn’t take over but is still present. Full bodied and quite powerful.
yellow body and white head. malty aroma of bread and little grainy. bitter in the end, flavor not very special, but a good lager.

Shows what a pale lager can be when brewed with all-malt. Low hopping brings forward the malt in this clean, refreshing example of a straightforward  German lager. Give me this any day vs the typical American lager.

Pours a very nice clear gold with thick, creamy white head that leaves some very attractive lacing on the glass. The aroma is mostly sweet, malty hay and floral/herbal hops. The flavor is pretty similar with the herbal hops coming through in a  subtle,  but very nice way. There is a hint of metal in there that detracts a bit. The mouthfeel is is pretty light, with a clean dry finish. Pretty good lager overall.

Pours a crystal clear pale yellow with a large white head.  The aroma is rather malty sweet without much hop character.  The flavor is nice and clean with plenty of malt.  The finish is a bit thin, but with a solid dry finish.

Although I am an ale man, lagers serve their purpose in my life. Like when I want to drink a beer, but my body tells me I should be drinking water. Although it’s not fantastic, Spaten holds a place in my heart and I usually go for their lager. Not all beers are meant to be a full-on attack on your taste buds, but for the style should still be worthy. Pours into my Spaten lager glass light with a healthy head that doesn’t hang around too long.  Well carbonated, light color.  Smells like any other decent lager, has a semi-sweet taste at first sip.  Well balanced for such a light beer.  Easy to take out the majority of a six-pack after a long day at work.
Didn’t really care for this one. It was too weak. Not a lot of flavor and I thought it smelled skunky. Maybe it was that particular bottle, but I sort of get the feeling it wasn’t just that one.
Aroma was subtle.  Appearance is average.  Flavor is similar to a pale lager.  Feel is nothing but ordinary.

Bottle. Pours yellow with a white head. Malty aroma with notes of straw and bread. Medium/thin body and a flavor that is very similar to the aroma. A very average beer, which disappeared very quickly from my glass.

Bottle 500 ml.
Pours clear pale yellow with a large white creamy head. Aroma of bread, grass and malt. Very light taste, some malt flavour and very low bitterness.

On tap at Rich O’s - Pours bright golden with a fully receding white head. Aroma of light malt (bready, cookie) and light noble hops (herbs,grass). Taste is lightly malty with a light bitterness. Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Pretty solid lager,  nothing special. A good baby step for BMC drinkers.

Bottle. Pours a golden color with medium white head that diminishes quickly to nothing. The aroma is a bit skunky with grass. The taste was a light malt with a dry finish. Not too much going on with this one.

It says "original from Munich" on the label, altho it appears to be for export.  Sweet, floral aroma.  Straw-colored with a moderate head.  Simple but effective label.  A very pleasant light beer - gently hopped with a little sweetness, and disappears from the palate pretty quickly.  It does not grab one’s attention, but it is hard not to like.  Probably a good "lawnmower beer" as some guys like to say, altho for me, beer and yardwork do not mix very well.

Served from a mini keg. Aroma is weak. Moderate malts with some light grassy hops. Frothy, white head. Clear, full yellow body. Taste is a bit of sweat (not sweet, sweat), a bit unpleasent with some copper-metallic aftertaste. Watery mouthfeel and fizzy.
50cl bottle from Aldi.  Straw with a thick white head; heavy carbonation; fresh grassy hop aroma; slightly spicy honeyed flavour; fizzy on the tongue; dry but sticky finish. Better than expected.
I wasn’t planning on liking this, but it was surprisingly delicious, expecially when paired with a great meal from my local German restaurant.

12 oz. Clear gold with a medium head that settles into a creamy lasting ring. Aroma is pure skunk, with slight honey and grass. Flavor follows the same pattern. Light body is smooth and slightly dry. Might be a pretty good beer in other than a green bottle!
A beautuful clear golden color, with a pure white large foamy head. It smells like malt and corn mash. The taste is a little grainy. Refreshing if the beer is really cold and it’s hot outside.
Bottle 0.5 l. Pale yellow. Fruity, malty and a bit on the sweet side, both nose and flavor. Balanced, tasty and pretty full. Good.

Canned 50cl. It pours a pale yellow beer with an average white head. The nose is of bread, bacon, garlic and lemon. Rather hoppy with a metallic touch. The taste is of marzipan, vegetables and candy. Very sweet with a light salty note. Some smoked bacon showing up. Rather Bavarian. Strange finish with a hint of onion. This beer isn’t worth purchasing again.

A very funky aroma of old socks with a hint of corn. Very clean golden pour with white head. Flavor of sweet malt with just a hint of bitter on the finish. Really solid palate and carbonation all round mouthfeel is good. A solid beer all round good flavor. I might shoudl have given it another point for flavor. Aroma really knocked it down from a good rating.
12oz bottle from a variety pack. Average lager taste like MGD. Will drink again but will not buy again.

Bought from Aldi...89p I think! Quite deep gold in colour although the head is thin and patchy. Not much in the way of a nose, just a slight malt/hops note. Fairly full bodied, better than I expected, flavour is a bit lacking too, smooth and just a wee bit malty. Overall , this is ok for a cheap lager, would buy again.
Pours a bright gold color with a soft foamy white head.  Nice aroma of nuts and malt.  Flavor was okay, with a nice light hoppiness.  Aftertaste ruined it, bitter and skunky.  Not a fan of this one.

500 ml bottle. Lasting coarse greyish head over a pale brilliant yellow golden body. Dry, dusty and hayish hops to the nose. Vague notes of dry pale malts. Clean, semi-dry malt taste with fresh bittering hops. Crisp, but thin mouthfeel. Skinny body. Short, light bitter end. Easy to drink, easy to forget. But still  very quaffable.
a good beer.  i prefer spatens optimator but this is a tasty beer too.  i don’t remember too much about it, just that i liked the taste and finish.

Bottle from aldi. Aroma is pale slightly grainy pale lager malts, with a good grassy, slightly green hay hop character. Taste is of similar banter with a pepperyness at the end, quite a dry finish. Nice one i defo dig it.
Pours a pale golden yellow.  Clean and crisp, this one is perfect after mowing the lawn on a hot summer day.
Really nothing special, just a better version of some of the pale lagers you find in most bars.
The bottle looks a little bit too simple I think. The beer starts very modest. Tastes somehow like wheat without being spicy. Strange. Balanced finish, not bad!

Strong bitter aroma.
White soft foam and golden colour.
Strong wood flavor with a bitter palate.
Better taste in a cold winter.
If I was told I was only allowed one brand/style of beer for the rest of my life, this would be the one.  16.9 oz bottles only.  Don’t care for the "green"!
Its a pretty good beer that is atleast very drinkable and has some good flavor to it.  I would recommened trying it.
Rather rancid bitter aroma.  Aroma follows through to the flavor.  Not a fan of the "skunky" style brews.   First time drinker of Premium - and last time drinker of Premium.

(Bottle) Tastes like a German beer, but generic for one.  Some metallic taste surfaces...typical for a German import.  Some hops present, but not very hoppy.  Overall, not very impressionable.  I would gladly prefer this one to Beck’s but in my opinion, it’s significantly more boring than most of the other mainstream German imports.
Why is this beer rated so poorly? Tasty malts balanced almost perfectly with the flavorful, fragrant hops. Quenching and delicious.

Bottled.  A light gold coloured beer with an off white head.  The aroma is predominantly grassy hops with a bit of puke.  A reasonably balanced taste with malt and hops to the fore.  Nice enough flavours with no off putting buttery flavours I often find in this type of beer.  Score 2.4
Subsequent rating scored 2.8. Average becomes 2.6

Served cold from tap.There isn’t much to say about Spaten that hasn’t already been written. It’s a traditional lager, crisp and easy to drink, with nothing special or distinct about it. It’s fine when you’re at a bar that has limited options, but that’s about the extent of my desire to drink it.

I had this musty, stale yella Helles style Spaten on draft.   I wasn’t sure what to expect, but next time I’d skip for even a cheap American Pale Lager.    Hey, Germany, pls. export better beer than Spaten Premium to the USA.

12oz bottle part of "beers of the world" variety pack.. slightly golden coloration with a laced head.. smells bitter and the initial taste is that of a thinly breaded flavoring of malts with a very easy subdued hoppiness.. other than that its rather uneventful.. i do like the fact that it does not taste watered down and has a little bit of personality albeit very little.. i can see where the skunkiness has overpowered the flavor on the transatlantic trip over to the u.s.  this is a generous rating for a beer that I know deserves better.

Bottle. Pours very light gold.  Not much head, little lace.  Aroma is slightly skunky with malt and little hops.  Flavor is biscuity with a good amount of hop bitterness.  Could use some flavor hops.  Finish is bitter and a little metallic. Not terrible but not particularly good either.
This should be substituted for all crapweiser .  Crisp defines this beer.  Really traditional tasting lager.  Drink 6-10 of these.  fun times.

Im sure this might have been a much better beer fresh.....But unfortunately it will be a few years befor that happens or I brew it myself...This is one reason why I do not like to buy imported largers, they just loose so much.....This beer looked great and had a decient malty flavor and head retention was good. But once the smell hit my nose I was kinda dissapointed. Tasted alright, but after the aroma mishap, it just wasn’t the same. Time to go to Germany.....
Golden color.  Smell of hops, malt, bread adn minor spice.  Taste of malt, hops bread and spice.  Crisp finish.
Nice frothy long lasting head with an aroma strong in hops and yeast. Surprising medium body for such a clear yellow beer. Mild malt flavor with a smooth finish. Very drinkable.

Has a great noble hop nose, cyrstal clear gold in color. Tastes more like a regular Pils to me, rather than a Munich Helles.  In any event, I really like it, but then again I am partial to German beers.

Low expectations, and after reading the reviews, I can believe that this would be better at the source (Munich, not Texas).  Tasted like a very ordinary lager to me, albeit better than one that uses corn and/or rice.  Uninspired at best, blah at worst, but no drain pour.
Right from the first sip I could tell that travel was rough on this one. It looked great, but I got that skunky nose and odd hop taste. Shame, I bet this is great at the source.

I love the Spaten brews since living in munich, but I must admit out of all the german beers that travel trans-atlantic this one takes a large hit in shipping. Tasted nothing like it does from the brewpubs in munich. Overall was still "good" but was depressed that it didn’t have the true flavor that it has from munich.

I had sampled many Spaten brews when I was in Munich last month and enjoyed them all.  I ordered this one last night with dinner (back in the USA) and it was horrible.  This didn’t survive the trans-Atlantic trip very well.  At all.

Pours a nice crisp golden color with a foamy white head.  Aroma is of a very skunked beer.  The taste was the same.  I didn’t even finish it.  It was a shame...
This beer wasn’t that bad, a light hop taste, well balanced, but nothing to brag about.

Draught at Chef Paul’s Bavarian Lodge in Lisle, IL. As such, likely presented at close to it’s best outside of the brewery itself. Clean, basic lager aroma. Crystal clear, pale gold color with a frothy white head. Excellent lace. Dry, basic lager flavor. No flaws. A little watery. Not bad, but nothing spectacular.

From mini keg.  Mild golden color with somewhat fluffy white head.  Aroma malty, with  a bit of bitter hop.  Flavor also mildly malty, with a touch of euro hops and a decently bitter aftertaste.  Good, clean-tasting beer.

On tap at some Italian joint  in Westfield. I had heard of it before so I didn’t make the mistake of calling it by the same name as the break and muffler shop. Anyway,  light amber color, head disapated quickly. I know that because  I watched it. Had a strong odor of , of , of well beer, I guess. Tasted like beer too. A German beer oddly enough. Reminded me of Ringness(sp). Liked it so much I ordered three more.

If you’ve ever had Spaten Pils, this is a "kindler, gentler" version of it.  It is definitely not a "light" beer though.  It’s got a milder balance and not so bitter hops content.  As German beers go, this is pretty tame stuff.

Mild hop aromas, nothing uniquely complex.  Pours golden yellow with a white head.  Tastes of average hop bittermess and lightly of malt.  Nive drinkability and great for refreshment.  Overall nothing special.  Makes me wish this habit of making lagers lighter and lighter would pass.  Would like a more pronounced hop flavor profile.
Bottled 33 cl. A golden yellow beer with a tall creamy head.Aroma is very hoppy and herbs. Taste is sweet, malt and hops. Refreshing and drinkable. Dry finish

Tap. This light lager had a mild bite to it with elements of grains and hops. I served a 1/2 barrel of it at a huge Halloween Party last night along with the Oktoberfest and crowd seem to like it. It was very fresh.

50 cL botle (Original Munich Beer, Spain). Pours clear and golden yellow with a lacing white head. Somewhat hoppy nose, a bit skunky. Flavour starts soft malty with a little sweetness - and gains some bitterness before the finish. Malty flavour return far into the finish as a pleasant malt dryness - not the classic bone dry bitterhops.
Very malty and a lot of hay and grass in this beer.  Nice balance from the low level of bitteness.

This is very tasty, full-bodied, yet smooth and well-rounded.  It is gold, with a decent white head that dissipates steadily but slowly, and it’s bubbly.  The aroma is distinctly of grain and a bit flowery.  The taste is toasted grain, with a faint hop bite, and it has a crisp, almost tangy finish.  It has good, full body and fairly oily palate for a pale lager.  It is tasty and smooth, very easily drinkable.
Pours yellow and clear with a white head.  Smells of straw, some sugar, hints of fruit and citrus.  Tastes of dry malt, some peppery and some citrussy hoppy hints.  Not bad.
Nice soft pilsener like lager. Fine white head, and a mixed aroma of dusty hobs and grass. Quite easy to drink in larger quantities

In 1894 Spaten became the first brewery in Munich to produce this brand of light lager. Golden in color with a well-balanced hop-flavor. The full rounded body is a superb balance between hops and a malty sweetness. Also known as Spaten Münchner Hell and is sold under that name in Germany

Aroma/Malty-light,
Appearance Head/Initial - size/large, Head/Color-white, 
Body/Hue-clear,
Initial Flavor-bitter/light,
Finish/Flavor- bitter/light
Palate/Body-medium
beer

This beer is a yellow beer with no head at all. Aroma was skunky heiniken aroma. NOt too much taste at all, but quite drinkable at the end of the day... mostly thanks to the fact that the taste is small and mostly nonoffensive with the exception of the rancid skunkiness.

Ugh...I hate Dortmunders but I’ve had some that I could stand. This one I couldn’t. Pour was a light gold with no head. Aroma of skunk and malt. Taste was thick and lightly carbonated. Tasted like a less carnonated pilsener with no hoppiness and no aftertaste...which leaves not much. Blah..hard to believe this is the brewer of the Optimator

Pours a crystal clear gold with with lots of rising bubbles and one finger of frothy head that diminishes fairly quickly. The nose is fairly muted with light, crisp, slightly perfumed pale malt and lightly grassy hops. Light-bodied with lively, fine carbonation and a crisp, clean and just lightly bitter finish. Light, sweet, malt front with a crisp, clean finish. The hops are there at the end but play a minor role in the flavor profile. For a lager, it’s actually pretty nice. I’m beginning to see that my preference among lagers leans toward the Helles, Marzen, Vienna side of things vs. the junk that I consumed in mass quantities back in college.
Bottle under the Munchner Hell label in Triberg.  Average, enjoyable drinkable beer.  Light and refrshing at any time.
Kinda like the German Bud or Coors....but a lot better. Crisp tasting and refreshing.

Class: Light Lager/Munich Helles - Aroma: Light malt forward, sweet and clean aroma. Light hop with some corn and citrus like aroma. Hop is light and in background. Appearance: straw yellow with white head, fair retention. Flavor: Moderate malt accentuated beer that is not overly sweet, but rather focuses on malt flavor with underlying hop bitterness in a supporting role. Finishes dry with mellow malt with lingering light bitterness. Overall impression: Malty, but fully attenuated. Not as crisp and light as American Lagers, but is one step up in maltiness without the "heaviness" of Pilsners and Ales. I think that because hops take a back seat to the malt, that it makes it boring and too malty. However, I think everyone should try this beer at least once due to it’s historical heritage. Cheers.

50cl bottle from systembolaget.   Sparkling gold appearance with a thin head that dies quickly.   Aroma is pretty weak with a little malt and citrus.   Body and carbonation are both somewhere in the middle to light.   Flavors are dominated my malty sweetness with just a little hop and not really very much bitterness.   Boring, but nothing particulary bad about it.
On tap. Nice color. Small head. Wonderful aroma. Tastes like an upscale American light. Very good overall.

On tap.  Pour is crystal clear with stark white foam.  Very nice herbal hop aroma with some nice maltiness.  Flavor is just a little sweeter than I like my Helles, finish is gone in an instant.  Very quaff able.
golden color. light tastes of light berryfruit. salty and effervescent with acceptable body. broomstraw malt and a noticieable sense of alcohol. this ain’t no optimator!
Bottle, from LIVA, Domhusgade, Kolding. Pours golden with a medium foamy white head. Malty sweet aroma. A bit thin with relatively low carbonation. Flavour is limited, sweet and light.

A surprise rating generated at a BJCP training session, didn’t realize that I had never rated this.  Pale gold, gentle malt aroma.  Light hay and grassy hops balancing things out on the finish.  Flavor and aroma identical.  Nice.

draft. pours a clear light yellow with a bubbly on finger white head. aroma is straw and grass. has a light body, spotty lacing, and descent carbonation. flavor is the same as aroma. not to much to say here it is an ok helles.

Poured a pale golden color with a wispy head of white foam that dissipated quickly. The nose was light with grassy notes of hay and hops with a slight skunkiness. The malt is nicely grainy, and sweet with Munich malts; and it acts as blanket for grassy and spicy hop flavors. It’s bitterness is solid and clearly present, but not too bold. The feel was thin and light. Certainly one of the least offensive beers one could try, but simple in scope and complexity. Not a bad brew to offers noobies before moving them on to more complex beers. This one would certainly hit the spot after along hot day.

on tap at Blarney Stone pub.  My first impression was poor due to the gimp pour of this brew. I assumed it was another watered down "premium lager" similair to stella but its interesting to see its a dortmunder.  I felt like i was drinking a St. Pauli or Becks, But a bit more malty and a fuller bodied brew.   I prefer this over most pale beers.  very well rounded brew, solid in everyway.

Name: Spaten Lager

Date: 06/22/2007

Mode: Draft

Source: Das Bierhaus, WI



clear pale yellow, fine white head, drippy lace, 
light malt aroma with a hint of corn, 
sweet malt flavor, touch of bready character, low bitterness, 



Aroma: 3/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 4/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 8/20

Rating: 2.1/5.0
Drinkability: 6/10

Score: *+/4

Pours yellow with a bubbly, carbonated head that disappears after a short while. Maybe I just haven’t found the right one yet but German pale lagers all look and taste the same to me.  It’s not a pale lager but it looks and acts like one.  Malty.  It’s somewhat refreshing.  Above average but not something I buy frequently.
pours gold with a creamy white head. nice lacing.  flavor is a little watery; malts, wheat, and a slight hop flavor.  decent but a little boring.
Pours a golden color with a fluffy head. Tastes somewhat sour and has a skunky aroma. Wheat body that is very refreshing and a bit malty. Not bad.

I quite enjoy the smooth rounded  medium body.  Nose is light and peary.  A pretty gold with a healthy head that settles nicely in the glass.  Slightly chilled this is quite pleasant with a slow salty to sweet finish.

bottle: great flavor. even better going down. very crisp

mini keg: very dissapointing. the crisp aftertaste was there but it tasted like water

Golden color. Malt flavors taste low quality. Smells a bit pukey. Reminds me of someone puking at a college party. It doesn’t activate my taste buds. Chose to pour the last few sips down the sink. Not something I would want to drink again.
Good sweet lager that should be at a higher score then it is. Better then most beers that cost twice as much

Bottiglia da 50cl comprata all’Iper di Serrapalle; chiara lager con schiuma candida discreta ma evanescente. Aroma cerealoso simile a quello della oktoberfestbier, sapore buono. Una hell senza pretese che però si lascia bere.
Aroma is lightly grassy. Flavor is rather sweet with a strange hop hit. Not a huge fan on this one.
Botle, gold colour with a large head. An initial grassy aroma with hints of soured milk.  Very light tasting, bland enough but with a slight hoppy finish. Nothing incredible.

A bit surprised at the low rating for this one.  I’m not much for lagers, but I really like this one.  Very light, slightly sweet flavour.  Highly drinkable and I think this would make a great summer session beer (if it were readily available here in beer-starved Ontario).

Bottle. Sweet floral hop aroma. Bright, brassy gold color with a head that filmed quickly. Medium bodied, mildly carbonated, tastes of pale malt sweetness and light stone fruit. It is balanced, though the hop is not so much bitter as floral. Clean, crisp, and so much better than so many lagers. Must be one of the best of the style. A lager I can actually enjoy drinking. That’s rather unusual.

Typical taste.  Light malt, big yeasty, doughiness.  I hate it.  Piss gold, white head, musty smell and taste and a bit undercarbonated.  Call it a dortmunder/helles, but it still is boring, average, and I don’t like anything about it.  Paid 5.25 for it on tap and left half of it.
Bottle. Golden coloured with a decent white head. Sweet malt aroma with a whiff of hay and floral hops. Flavour started sweet with some herbal hops and a decent, dry finish. Not bad.

8/1/07 From the bottle.  Aroma is sweet malt forward with low citrus hop notes and some DMS/pils notes.  Appearance is medium yellow with a low white chunky head.  Flavor is bready munich malt forward, sour, with a faint nuttiness and lightly bitter.  Mouthfeel is light bodied with some lingering starchiness in the finish.  Texture has a medium carb feel, but low bite.  Overall, easy drinking, with a little more flavor than American lagers.
It actually poured pale yelloow and had nice malt aromas.  The palate was clean, crisp, and dry with very lightly sweet malt flavors.  It has a minor length on the finish.
Robe blonde très claire surmontée d’une mousse blanche mince. Arômes de moufette. Saveurs de malt.
clear gold with a very little frothy head. citrusy grain aroma. medium smooth body. semi sweet malt with a bitter lemon flavor

Bottled. Beer is clear, light gold with a small, white, frothy, mostly and rapidly diminishing head.The aroma is malty with light notes of slightly husky toasted grain; Hoppy with a light, dull herbal note, moderate note of lemon zest.The flavor is lightly/moderately sweet, moderately bitter, lightly/moderately acidic with a long, lighly/moderately bitter, lightly sweet, lightly acidic finish.The body is light, the texture is watery and the carbonation is lively.
(12oz bottle): Clearish yellow color. Malty fresh aroma.. Clean taste, watery, hops. Crisp malty aftertaste.

Draught. Pours yellow with a fluffy, lasting white head. Aroma is bready malt and a bit of aromatic hops. Flavor is similar, with slight bitterness in the finish. Very similar to Spaten Pils actually; just somewhat toned down on the hops. Pretty good for the style.
came as a gift in a mixed pack: poured golden in color with plenty of bubbles. smell is light hops and a little skunk funk. decent in taste, plenty of carbination, not one i need a lot of for sure.

Bottle. High white fluffy but lasting head. Clear light yellow body. Weak barley malt aroma. Sweet, weak and boring barley malt flavor with little hops bitterness or anything else. I doubt that corn has been added the taste actually indicates it. Low carbonation, short aftertaste. Not soon forgotten - i’ll remember it for how boring it is.
From tap pours clear golden color with quickly fading head.  Nice bitter flavor with a good strong aftertaste.

On tap from the Trenton Thunder game on 7/16/07.  Pours a crispy golden color with a small white head.  There was a tiny bit of lacing...but I was drinking from a damn plastic cup.  A light sourness followed by some malt, hops, and a sweet finish.  Not bad, considering my other options at the game, but this is one and done for me.
Bottle. Nose is grassy and slightly sour. Yellow beer with a white head. Fine palate, immensly drinkable and refreshingly full bodied. Uncomplex but enjoyable flavor.
bottle,bread, skunky, golden, clear, frothy, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, lively, Ok,nothing great ,but would drink again.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is malt, fruit. flavour is sweet, malt, apple, fruit, grain. Ordinary.
Tap at Sportbar neer the station 0.5ltr: Golden looking Helles with caramel hints.

A light, golden color. Fizzy with a full white head that disappeared quickly. The aroma,as best I can describe it, citrus (lemon and maybe orange). The taste had a tinge of sweetness and light sourness, which I guess accounts for the citrus tones. This one went down smoothly.
Great light-Helles lager. Personally the best helles available in my neck of the woods. Available at our local german joint, the Student Prince. A very consistent brew, never skunky.

Bottle. (as Spaten Original Munich Beer) Clear, pale golden beer with a nice, beige head. Quite grainy nose, yet balanced with fruityness. The flavor has fruityness, grain and bitterness. Quite bitter finish. Medium body. Refreshing. (070527)

Medium offwhite shiny head. Pale yellow body. Light straw aroma. Dry, straw taste with grainy, grassy hop notes. Aftertaste is like the main taste. Clean, sharpish mouthfeel. It’s OK, but not very special. (0.5l bottle at Oliver Twist.)

0,5 l bottle.
Under the name Spaten Munchener.
very bright, thick head.
fresh fruity aroma, sweet and round and mild.
long lasting finish.
Ordinary.
Bottle. Straw yellow color. White head. Aroma of malt, hops, and grass. Flavor includes malt, hops, and grain. Clean, but not harsh to palate. Bitter finish. Good, but not spectacular.

Vom fass at Kugler Alm, Oberhaching 16 Jun 07. Pale golden. A small creamy head. Sweet malty aroma. Hardly any flavor. Sweet bitter finish. Also tried the Radler variant - blended 50% with lemon lemonade.
500ml vom fass at Kugler Alm. Clear golden body. Thin filmy layer. Some sweet fruity notes in aroma and flavour. Missing aftertaste. Semi-dry palate. Thin and overcarbonated. Rather dull (16.06.2007)

12 oz bottle at Rabbit’s on Foster.  Well I was most impressed by their knowledge of how to pour a hacker-pschorr.  But since this was only $3 I’ll try this one on round two.  Pours a slightly hazed yellow white head.  Nose of malts, grains, hint of citrus.  Light body similar flavors slightly sweet.  A few grassy notes coming out.  Meh, it works.
16 oz draft, Bavarian Lodge Lisle, IL. Medium amber color, lively off white head. Small nose, some maltiness with little to no hops. Light bodied with a clean finish. Good, not great.
It will get you drunk, better then heineken...good pong beer because  it sucks when you have to drink it  if you like the taste of ball sweat you will love spaten...
bottle.  light lager golden color.  skunky hop smell.  tastes slightly hoppy with a dry cedar finish.  It has flavor but not that enjoyable.  I can taste a relation to optimator in the woody finish.

Served from a 5 liter mini keg. Pours a straw colored body with a medium sized rocky white head. Aromas of sweet grains, citrus and malts. Palate is light to watery, medium carbonation. Finish is medium length, slightly sweet and somewhat bland. An easy drinking beer for poolside.
Yellow colour with a white head. Light malty sweet aroma with fruity notes. Malty, grainy sweet flavor with fruity notes.
Bottle. Yellow colour with a white head. Aroma of vegetables & sea salt. Malty flavour with more vegetables involved.
Nothing stands out, it tastes more like a pale lager than anything else. Weak flavor, no malt or hop character, carbonated and slightly watery.

On draft in Chicago.  I guess it’s fine for the style-- a light Gernam lager.  But Imy taste buds are longer for a little more body and a little more malt.  It almost seems like a transition beer-- a step up from BMC, but not too big or heavy.  Much rather have something a little mroe interesting in the flavor-- like a saison or a maibock.

I like this beer, extra cold. It is full flavored, great head, nice  skunk aroma, awesome finish.
I really like this beer.
I really enjoyed this beer, nice malty flavor with nice golden color and good mouth feel.
draught a Max’s Allegheny Inn - Not a bad beer but a bit light for a German brewed beer, I’ve had more body and malt flavor in other lagers - some made in America. Nice brisk hoppy finish

bottle; golden hue with an egg white head, above avg in volume.  aroma not too skunky.  it seems to be what heine wishes it was.  undertones of domestic grasses and bright fruit.  kudos on the former two.  taste yields a mirror image to the aroma, but adds by a pleasant floral taste, as well as lively hops, but nowhere near overpowering.  it’s a pleasant grilling-out beer, for its style.  the malts are rather sugar-ish.  all in all, good normal beer.

Sweet malty skunk aroma. Pours a light gold color. Flavor is mostly crisp somewhat metallic. Mildly sweet. Not alot going on here, but again, I was on the crisp lager kind of thing today. A little dry too.
Poured gold, decent head, Sweetish, malty, hint of hops, easy drinking, decent brew.

Draft.
Clear yellow coloured with a white head.
Aroma of malts, grain and fruits.
Flavour of malts, grain, fruits and hops.

Bottle, Pizza Shoppe KCMO.  Poured into .5L Spaten glass, nice touch!  Pour is clear golden with a big white head.  Not much aroma, but what is there is bright hops.  Taste is pretty straight forward, finishes quick with not much jumping out.  Pretty blah, overall.
Bottle. Golden, with decent white head. Aroma is bland, some noble hops. Clean, crisp and nothing special.

Tapped. (?) (2:2:4:3:9=2.0)

Slightly too light, almost looks diluted. No distinct aroma, but it was served quite cold. Bready taste with some bitterness. Pleasant on the tongue, but nothing stays after swallowing.

Rerate: Tap (Kodu, Tallinn) (4:2:4:2+:9=2.1)

Light fruity aroma, a little like white grape a la champagne, but very genlte, barely there at all. Slightly watery palate, decent carbonation. Just a little bit of light grains ni the taste, not enough to call bready. Finish more of the same, but does have a little bit of a bit of noble hops. Totally emasculated of course. Clean - certainly uncontaminated by flavour.
pours the same goldish tint as warsteiner and with the same creamy thick foam. taste is a little malty, bread like, with a follow up of hops. wins by a hair to me choosing between this is warsteiner.

bottle ..light golden pour , thin white head , no lacing . aroma of bready malt, and slight skunk . starts sweet and doughy but bitters with grassy hop flavors. crisp and ligh,t easy drinking but not great .
Bottle.  Aroma of german malt.  The flavor is like a pale lager with some bready malt.  Crisp and slightly sweet finish.
Poured a clear gold; decent sized head.  Aroma of corn, malt and bread.  Flavor was alot of bready malt; not much cookie like taste.  Didnt enjoy it that much; but not actively bad.
Clear golden with a tiny white head. Soft bread and straw in a boring aroma. Plain body and boring flavours of light bread and staleish grassy hops. Clean finish. Very ordinary.
Moderate hoppy aroma. Large frothy white head. Fair lacing. Mostly diminishing longevity. Clear yellow body. Light sweet initial flavor. Light to medium palate.

Rated 2004-05-09. Golden, medium white head which lowers slowly, tiny lace. Fruity, slightly flowery and sweet aroma. Light to medium bodied. Flowery, malty, hoppy and grassy flavor. Dry, medium length finish. Nothing special in this lager.

Bottle.  Not much head and what it had dissipated quickly.  Slightly skunky smell.  Smooth taste, clean and crisp.  A better version of Heineken, perhaps.  The taste grows on you and you could definitely drink a bunch of these.

Pale golden with medium sized carb bubbles and a reasonably sized creamy white head. Some mealy biscuit maltiness and some faint grassy hops. Rather neutral flavour initially, although the sweetness does seem to pile up and get a bit too much. Light to medium bodied with a nice carbonation level. Started off okay but it was one of those beers that fell more out of favour with every mouthfull.
Bottle 33o ml. Nice taste and Golden color. The Flavor is a little more strong than some Brazilian Lager beer.

Pours golden and quite clear. Malty aroma balanced with some hops.
Quite strong body also. A bulk beer but better and tastier than for example most finnish bulk lagers.
Pour is a light clear gold with a white head.  Aroma of hops, a little malt, and some skunk.  Flavor is pretty much the same, hops, malt ,and some skunk.  Pretty standard lager.
For a lager, this was definatly better than average. Clear, pale appearance with a slight hop in the taste.

Bottle, 50 cl. Clear golden, medium fluffy white head. Bready, somewhat grainy malt aroma, with a slight roated or toffeish touch, and some faint hop notes. Medium bodied, decent mouthfeel. Some initial sweetness is well taken care of by a moderate but distinctive bitterness.
Bottle. Clear yellow colour with small white mostly diminishing head. Malty aroma. Sweet bitter flavor.

Draft: Not the most exciting of beers, but a very enjoyable drink nonetheless.  Honey aroma and taste that lingers all through the finish.  Will definitely buy again.


Bottle: nice foamy head, gold body.  Still loving the malty aroma.  There is just a dash of hop in the aroma  This time I got the hints of metallic taste that I’ve read about.  Also some old grass flavor in the finish that I didn’t notice before.  Not at all unpleasant, actually.  I still stand by my original rating, but I thought I’d share the expanded comments.
Light yellow and clear. Has a white, mostly diminishing head. Aroma is light malt, light bread. Flavor starts light bitter, finish is heavy sweet, floral.
While admitting that lagers are not my favorite, especially pale ones, I have to say that this is much better than most.
On tap from Rich o’s Public House.  Nice golden colour.  Was enjoyed by all who sampled it.
Bottle. Clear light golden colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of malt and hops.
good beer, good pour, wish i lived in germany so the beer would be cheaper, seems like a good default beer.

On tap at the Sharp Edge Creekhouse in Pgh, thanks mtoast!  Once poured, the look of this beer is ubiquitous pale yellow American lager. From the beginning, the head is a thin white froth that is barely present.  It presents a girdle around the inside edge of the glass.   Aroma is very mild, barely detectable, beery yeast smell that is so common with lagers. From the onset, the taste is friendly lager, very gentleman in the mannerisms.  I am very surprised this is styled as a dort/helles, it is so American lagerlike that I can’t see that style. Absolutely no hints of oppressive bitterness, easy to like and easy to enjoy.   This beer will not offend anybody except the imperial stout and IPA drinkers. This beer is a mild lager that is repeatable and can be a good session brew.   No lager lover will complain about this beer, enjoyably excellent. During the finish there is an unexpected slight low bitterness that builds. Overall this is your typical American style lager and tho it is a good brew, there are many other cheaper beers out there that achieve the same attributes.  For example, Schmidt’s is a good lager beer with the same characteristics but is much less expensive.  As far as dort/helles goes, this beer is not quite as good a Lowenbrau but it does not posses any of the negative qualities that I found with Great Lakes Dort and Victory V lager.
Aroma of grain and floral notes. Has a pilsner character with what tastes like Spalt or Saaz hops-but they’re not particularly pronounced. Ok but not really a fave of mine from this brewery.

Bottled (as Spaten Munchen).  Clear golden, brief creamy head. Malt aroma with some butter and paper. Sweet and medium bodied, solidly malty. Creamy malt followed by a lightly salty finish. Pretty good standard helles with a very light industrial touch to it.
Bottled as Spaten Munchner Hell. A golden beer with a medium white head. Aroma and flavour are malty and bready with a decent hopping. Medium body. A good helles, perhaps a little underrated.
Bottle. Golden, straw-colored with a sizable, white fluffy head. Not very hoppy smelling. Tastes of malt. No outstanding characteristics. That being said, it is still a pretty good German lager.
Lots of head and lots of carbonation within the beer which I like.  The finish is also very "carbonated" and it has a goodly amount of hops.  Fairly good as lagers go.

Had this in a beer garden or I should say pub in a Munich suburb. It was funny as most of the staff was foreign. Sweet and not a great helles Page 436 of Michael Jackson’s Great Beer Guide and only  247 of his 500 Classic Brews to go.
Bottle.  Lots of head, pours yellow gold.   Skunk-ish but some hops and complexity you don’t get in other pale yellow lagers.

Bright yellow gold color, with a rocky white head, leaving laces, skunky nose at the opening of the bottle, pale malt graininess note, sweet malt, faint floral hop aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a crisp sweet pale malt character, hint of honeyness, spicy vanilla, mild flowery hop accent ,leading towards a sweet pal maltiness, anf a faint hop bitterness finish.
I dont care for the aroma much, as its very pungent. However, the mouthfeel is excellent and pure. The flavor is hoppy and full of mulling spice. An excellent beer and deserves a try.

golden lager with a minimal white head.  This is, no doubt, a well made beer.  But I bought a few bottles of this in a variety twelve pack with Spaten’s Optimator and Fransziskaner Hefe and it just doesn’t compare.  Still, compare this tasty helles to an American macro like a Michelob lager and you see how much better they make them in Germany!
Aroma is sweet and slightly hoppy.  Mildly flavorful, but sweet and somewhat offensive.  Not my favorite from spaten.

Boa espuma, a qual se manteve por um bom tempo. Coloração dourada. Possui aroma e sabor maltados e metálicos, se diferenciando um pouco das "pilsen" brasileiras. Média carbonatação (excelente). Cerveja que desce macia. Uma das melhores da categoria.

Bottle. Pours out gold and clear with a white head. Aroma is a simple malty smell. Has light sweet taste with a bit of bitterness in the after taste. light but good on the palate. overall a good lager

On tap.  Clear golden pour with a thin white head.  A bit of lacing, nothing exciting.  The aroma was sweet malt and a bit grassy.  Flavor is a nice combination of sweet malts and a bit of hoppiness.  The hops do get a bit dominated by the sweet malt in this brew.  The mouthfeel is pleasant for what it is.
Bottle. Golden with a nice white head. Aroma of malt, some sweetness and hops. Flavour is smooth with a good maltiness, nice hoppiness. Short dry hoppy finish.

Early in my beer drinking days (actual beer not macros), I fell in love with spaten optimator and scneider aventinus.  The only place I knew to get german beer was a restaurant not too close to me.  Once I moved to manhattan and found all sorts of beer everywhere, I knew I had to try other german beers, so I started with this Spaten Lager.  Compared to the optimator, I obviously was not impressed.  I guess some people like these heineken, peroni, budweiser no-taste watery beers.  I only give it good marks because I think it at least beats out those aforementioned ’premium lagers.’

Cerveja alemã, também conhecida como Spaten Munchner Hell. Cerveja amarga; coloração e espuma normal; cheiro suave de lúpulo, muito bom. Apesar de ser mais encorpada que as brasileiras normais, ainda é aguada. É uma boa cerveja, refrescante e forte, deixando um gosto forte de cerveja na boca, amargor residual agradável. Tem um traço frutado de manga no cheiro e no sabor. Vale experimentar outra.

I bought this one in New York city. Imported. ven though it says Spatten premium and smells like a lager it is closer to a pils. Very sweet and a good dose of hops. Good but not great. It taste like a bunch of beers I have had in my life. The fter taste is too sweekt though. Decent.
Nice light lager with munich undertones, slight bitternes, but not too overpowering good drinkin brew
Pours a light yellow, like apple juice. Sweet like apple juice too. Easy to drink, but not much here. Pleasant taste.

Bottled. Pale yellowin colour, rich bubbly white head, lacings. The aroma is sweet and malty. The flavour is malty, sweet with hops.. Not all that exciting... But quite drinkable. Thanks to TBone_ for this brew.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Another JAP beer me (Just Another Pilsner), although I did think it had a pleasant nuttiness and balanced hop and sweet malt body. In keeping with the style it has a very pale straw colour and short-lasting head. Easy to drink but unchallenging for my palate.

Clear golden color with a thin white head that disappeares quickly. Soft smell of sweet malts. Very very smooth flavor of sweet malt with a mild hoppy aftertaste. Surprisingly nice palate for this a dortmunder (very smooth on the tongue).  A little metallic finish. Overall a very sweet and amazingly easy to drink beer. Good to have around and to match with light food.
Bottle.  Pale yellow color, white head that dissipated quickly.  Aroma of corn, spice, taste is thin, smooth with a clean finish.  Easy to drink.
Bright amber, generous white head. Surprisingly bitter and grainy to begin with, followed by a waft of vanilla-popcorn creaminess in the afternose. An accomplished hoppy-malty balance.
Pours light yellow with a short lived head. Tasted like a good heineken, which means it wasn’t so good. I was very disapointed with this beer since I had their oktoberfest first and liked it a lot.
Smooth. but not exceptional.  Light yellow, straw color with a slightly malty aroma.  Tastes more ile a pilsner than a lager.
Bland. Sweetish with no hops and not even much grain flavor. I won’t buy again.

This had hardly any aroma.Small head.Color light straw.It tasted rather bland.Had that golden beer taste that I hate,although it was not strong.Good beer for Germans,but NOT Americans!Ha!Ha!Actually,it would be good for the average beer drinker,who doesn’t know the really good stuff.
Bottle. The flavor has a bit of malt, but not much else. Easy to drink but nothing special.
pours light yellow, sweet skunky smell. easy to drink, sweet finish, a small step up from macros.

I used to drink this beer at a beer savvy bar I frequented when in college, before I knew much about beer.  It had been a few years since I’d had a Spaten lager.

This beer pours a faint yellow, with a tightly packed white head with excellent lacing for a pale lager.

Its aroma was subtle, and a sweet malt smell.

Its flavor is also light.  It is sweetly malty, barely hopped, and very refreshing.  It scratches a different itch than the American craft ales I’ve been drinking of late.

I could drink an awfully lot of this beer.

Pours a nice golden color with two fingers of head.  Aroma is very fresh and crisp, and reflects the taste which is ultra smooth.  Very drinkable with a nice sweetness and a very mild hop finish. Great for a helles.
Light yellow and clear, with a medium white head.  Heavy malt aroma, with a bit of age on it.  Grainy and sour.  Bout what I expected.
On tap at Bavarian Bier cafe, Sydney. Interesting enough character, with some nice citrus and spice flavours. Nothing special, and probably not worth $9.50 a glass.

Bottle 49F Lager Glass. Light sweet aromas, with light citrus and hops. Very clear light gold color. with standard german fluffy head.  Mettalic sort of taste, kind of sweet, very light malts and light hops. Easily drinkable. Farily light palate but not overly watery. Really not too bad, but nothing very special as seems to be the case of many flagship brews for big breweries.

An average beer outta germany that leaves a nice head lacing and is good and sweet smelling. Good straight out taste that is smooth and very slightly bittered, Very Good beer that could be drunken anytime.

Nice yellow-gold color, but a head that fades too quickly. Decent hop and yeast aroma, accompanied by a very balanced malt/hop flavor. A quality beer, but there’s nothing about it that really stands out.

Had it on tap at the Essen Haus in Wisconsin Dells. Pale bread bottom ferment; and a great sesssion beer.  It has a very nice flavor and if you don’t like it then drink an ale, because this is a great experience for the style. Perfect for a night long pounding.

Yes, more like a standard Pilsener than a Helles, but still a well balanced profile between the hops and malt.  It is what it intends to be-easily quaffable and light.  I got a bunch on sale so I can’t argue, but I wouldn’t pay for it otherwise unless I were in Germany.  A good Pils.
Perhaps I’m splitting hairs here, but this seems more like a standard pilsner to me.  Not bad, nice hayiness and hops, but it doesn’t hold a candle to GLBC Dortmunder Gold.

Tap... pale golden color wth a white head.  Finished nicely, with a clean malt flavor.  Average lager, good for quantity but I wouldn’t waste money on it if I want a beer to enjoy.  I prefer the Hacker-Pschorr Edelhell-- thats me though
Bottle. Pale yellow color with a fine white head. Aroma of yeast and hops. Medium carbonated. Dry bitter and short finish.
Aroma of yeast, some flowers as well. Pale colour, no foam. Unfortunately this reminds me of the typical pisslager. Nothing special about this one.

Gold color light , clear – frothy thick  white head –nose is grains, grassy , cereal, hopps , malts , and  clean  - taste of malts , grainy , grassy , sweet corn , hopps , and hint of orange peel – dry slight sweet mouth feel – skunky  , cereal , bitter , grass , sweet corn  aftertaste

12 oz bottle.  Purchased this one for comparison along with a 12 pack of Spaten Oktoberfest.  Just getting in the mood for October..  Had it straight from the bottle.   Decent lager aroma, familiar Dortmunder flavor.   Smooth and pleasant, with plenty of hop character and no off flavors or aromas.  Not bad.
Small head, golden clear body.  Nice hop aroma,  suttle sweetness balancing it out.  Very light on flavor but good.  Nothing off except for very little carbonation which doesn’t seem right.
No too bad. Except the beer label reminded me of someone taken a shit. It was okay.
Very little head, dissappearing quickly, very light, clear pale.  watery mouthfeel, no aftertaste.  Can’t even really tell i’m drinking a beer.  nothing to write home about
Not bad for a lager.  Has a think mouth feel.  Malty and possibly a bit sweet.  Very clear with frothy head.

Pours pale golden w/ a medium spritzy froth. Aroma is weak and malted,  w/ a burnt caramel goin’ ons. Medium nectar w/ ample residual effers. Flavors are crisp w/ a nice balanced maltiness. I detect a slight metalic nuance that is only briefly offensive. Theres a bit of a burnt caramel garter going on in the nose and flavor.  Overall: I’m not digging it. Kinda funky.

On tap at Pocono Brewing Co. Poured a slighlty cloudy gold with a quickly disappearing white head. Light, indistict aroma. Flavor is slightly sweet along with some hops bitterness. Overall an ok beer but I was expecting more.
As near to a perfect balance between hops and malt as ever encountered. Goes down ever so nicely, leaves no unpleasant aftertaste, and overall a splendid brew.
buona birra bionda, dal gusto impeccabile molto equilibrata e dal sapore molto lineare ottima bionda!
Pours a ligh gold with a moderate head; the aroma is sweet malt and bit of crisp hops. The flavor is grainy , some cookie malt, laid-back hops. Very clean finish, no aftertaste.

Sampled on draft at Olde New York this beer poured a bright golden color with a huge creamy orange-white head that lingered and left decent lacing. The aroma was sharp and crisp perfumey hops with a touch of artificial grape. The flavor was sweet artificial sugar, perfume, artificial grape and Pez. Medium length finish. Medium body. Meh.

You really can’t beat the quality of the beer for the price you pay. Aroma is really nice with typical grassy hops notes and slightly sweet. Appearance is light gold in color, nice head. Mouthfeel is light and clean. Flavors were fairly average with said grassy notes with some sweet malt to it too. Very clean finish, no aftertaste at all. Nice refreshing beer that I can usually find for about $5.99/6-pack.
Bomber, Piss yellow body with a nice head and retention. Light tasting , more of hops than malt. Slightyl ethery with a dry crisp finish.Better than most!

I think this is the right beer... the label just says Spaten Premium and in small letters says "malt liquor".  Light yellow body with quarter inch off-white head.  Mells hoppy and yeasty.  Does not taste like much really.  Hops are present, as well as some malt.  Alcohol is also presnt somewhat.  Not too keen on this one.  It’s definitely more flavorful than the American macro lagers, and if you have to choose between this and them, choose this.  That having been said, it’s not something I’d seek out.

I was very pleased with this beer, here in Panama. It is what it is, and it is a good beer to go with a meal, especially a spice meal here in Panama where it is hot. It pours clean with a nice large head, and a clear straw yellow color. It is fresh and dry on the palate, with enough complexity to be enjoyable but not so much that it competes with food. It wasnt sweet or cloying, and I could have had more than one, and there were no off flavors. It isn’t a special craft beer to ponder over, but it is the current king of beers available in Panama...go to Riba Smith grocers.

From the bottle for a rather unworthy rating #400.

Pours a light gold with a moderate head; the aroma is sweet malt and a bit of crisp hops. The flavor is grainy, some cookie malt, laid-back hops. 

Drinkable but not special.

Crystal clear golden color with white head. Aroma is yeasty, a bit skunky, malty and a hint of the noble hops. Overall this beer is mild in flavor. Taste starts off a bit sweet and grainy. There is also a light crisp hop spiciness. The finish leaves a nice grainy maltiness. Light refreshing brew for those hot summer days.

On draft Flat Rock Saloon.  Pours a clear gold with white head that quickly dissipated.  Bready nose with candi sugar also prevalent.  Sweet, malty flavor with a high level of carbonation.  Crisp and smooth.
pale yellow with fine white head. Aroma of yeast & hops. Medium carbonated. typical average lager. Dry bitter & short finish. Pleasant & slight above average!

33cl bottle
Pours very clear tellow with a white fluffy head.  Aroma is malty and hoppy as is the taste.  Not too bad, but nothing real special.

First rating
Initial Rating Date: 6/25/2006
50 cl bottle "Spaten München" from Swedish "Systembolaget".
Golden color, small white head. Malty a bit sour scent. Malty sour taste. Medium bitterness and mouthfeel.
6/3/6/3/11=2.9

Second rating
Draught at Waldwirtshaft Grosshesselhoe, München.
Tried as "Spaten Helles".
Clear golden color, white head. Sweet malty mixed with fruity hoppy scent. Sweet malty scent with an herbal hoppy aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel and aftertaste.
6/3/6/3/12=3.0

Rerate
50 cl bottle from Systembolaget
On February 27, 2009
Golden color, white head. Malty bready scent and taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium dry bitterness. Quite nice, not so sweet. Works very well with some German style food.
7/3/7/3/14=3.4

Rerate
Blindlagerprovning, tack Ingo!
Bottle on January 24, 2016.
Clear straw yellow color, smallish white head. Vegetal, light sulphur, chalk, some garbage scent. Grainy, slight metallic, hints of banana taste. Fruity, grainy, DMS aftertaste, also bitter. Medium to fizzy mouthfeel, low bitterness.
3/3/4/3/7=2.0

Pours clear yellow with pillowy white head.  Aromas has sweet grainy malt with light corn syrup.  Medium to light body with lots of carbonation.  Initial taste is grainy malts with a bit of slickness and traces of spiciness.  Finish has some of the malt, but the spicy hops are predominant.  Not that there is really that much of a hop presence - it’s just the main aspect of the finish.  Okay beer.
12oz bottle.  Indistingushable to me from most Eurolagers.  Good flavor, nice layer of foam.  Unremarkable.

As a cousin of the pale lager, this is a light golden yellow. The aroma shows quality hops though lighter than some from Europe. The flavor has a bit more bread than most lagers, is very smooth but with plenty of body and malt. The finish is light on hops, but the hop flavor is of top quality even if light, which makes this beer quite refreshing.
Pours light golden yellow with white head. Nice aroma of german hops. Extremely smooth and drinkable. Light malt sweetness with a crisp clean finish. Very drinkable.

Huh. A green bottled beer that isn’t skunky. Anyway, this poured from the bottle a light golden color. Medium sized head. Very watery and thin -- but refreshing in the summertime. When I was expecting the skunky and bitter kick at the end, I was surprised to find it missing. Not the best variation of a Dort/Helles, but a good lawnmower beer.

Draft in tall lager cylinder, at the Landmark Inn, Northbrook, IL. First time I’ve spotted this number. Good fluffy head with nice lacing. The smell is light on malty beeriness, but there is a nice spicy hop chracter. Taste is to match, quite crisp, and I think I can tell from the lighter hop load that it’s a Munich style. Refreshing beer, light on maltiness, but that just helps invite a second round.

This is the beer that started my appreciation for the taste of finer beers. So its got a special place in my heart.
Its aroma is nice and sweet and pleasant. It taste light and malty, with a sweet almost champagney taste.
Ah yes.  Bottle.  Not too bad actually.  Bready, and malty.  Crisp, and for someone like me who isn’t a huge fan of lagers, this one is one I’d drink.
On tap at the Spaten house, Munich. Good, crisp Lager. Refreshing, yellow, good balance and quenching qualities.

Aroma is light with only slight traces of sweet maltyness and faint traces of hops. Looks are pretty average but the head last a little longer and the beer has more lacings then normal, so in fact appearance is above average. The taste is very good. It has a sweet malty taste with not very much bitterness, and is pleasantly drinkable – even in large quantities. Mouth feel is again pleasant and smooth, no way as bitter as some north German lagers. Overall a superb lager that stands head and shoulder above the vast crowd of European lagers.

Noticable bready malt sweetness to begin. Soft on the palate with medium carbonation. Dry grassy hops to finish. Slight graininess lingers after the finish.  Overall well balanced and easy to drink. Comes across nicely for a lager type beer.
The aroma is lighly hoppish with a pour that is light golden and a fizzy white head.  Light hoppish flavor with some malt sweetness and a light finish.

Bottle 0,5L. 27/2-06.
Golden colour , with a thin foam. Sweet maltynes with werry thin bitternes. Domintaes of the maltyness, non balnce. Thin body, and short finish.

first dortmunder, nice.  too bad this beer sucked so much.  had it after the optimator, which perhaps isn’t fair.  but still, this just tasted like a heineken or some soulless german mass produced beer.  europeans sure love bread in their beer.

Golden light body; white average head quickly vanishing; large bubbles of average density.
Intense malty aroma with moderate herbal notes.
Intense sweet malty flavour at the beginning that is later partially balanced by a moderate hoppy bitterness.
Light to medium body; lively carbonation; chalky feeling in the finish.
Light, with an intense aroma (even if not complex) and sweet notes that make it a beer above the average of lager beers.
Pours a ;ight-medium golden color with a big frothy whiye head.  Nose mostly of hops,  maybe a hint of apple as well.  Very smooth on the palate.  A nice lager.
Very large head, clear, but bubbly. Standard lager aroma. Very smooth, creamy palate. Lightly sour. Appart from the aroma, much superior to most stanard lagers. I  recommend this beer.
Clear pale amber color with a thin rocky white head. Sweety grain aroma with some corn notes. Sweet flavor with some grassy hints.
Pale golden body, minimal to no head.  Typical lager taste, though not the corn typical in mass-market lagers.  Cornish ending, slightly bitter.

This was a steal the glass night at Capital Ale House in Richmond, Va.  The beer was delivered in a ceramic mug so aspects of the beer were not observed.  The color was a straw color.  It was beer with balance hops and malt.  It was an enjoyable beverage  that is better than Heinken.
Pale golden color with an initial huge white head. Aroma is sweet and lightly grassy. Flavor starts lightly sweet followed by a light hop bitterness. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.
Tap at Richos:  Pours nice golden yellow with medium white head and a fair amount of carbonation.  Slightly malty aroma with a slight hint of bitterness.  Good example of a light golden lager

Medium gold with a medium white head that laces the glass as you drink, and lots of bubbles. Aroma is malty and the flavor is malty with a tiny hnt not of bitterness but sourness. A little bitterness is found in it’s aftertaste.

Fizzy yellow.  Typical looking lager.  However, tastes better then most.  Second to Paulaner.  For pale lagers macrobreweries I mostly like the German lagers.  Not a fan of other macros such as Heineken, Bud and the like.  Nice bitter finish.  Good German beer.
Yellow colour with a white mostly diminishing head. Aroma and taste of hops and malts. Sweet finish.
Draught. Creamy white fair mostly deminishing head. Yellow colour. Moderate hoppy and malty aroma. OK flavor, average finish. Very fizzy and a little watery.
Pours a golden yellow with white head.  Aroma of malt with a very faint hoppiness.  Flavor is a well-balanced blend of malt and hops with a underlying sweetness.  Crisp finish.
Clear gold w/ a big white puffy head. Nice crisp spicy finish. I was plesantly surprised. 36 rating seems a tad low. Good brew when I feel like putting a few back.

I’m drinking this beer from a can that has 1 Gallon, 1 Qt,, 9 FL. OZ. printed on it.  That’s right it is a mini keg.  I am dispensing it into a 22 oz. pilsner glass that I got from The Crab House in Orlando, FL.
It has a pale golden color that is absolutely clear.  It has a malty smell with some hop notes barely noticeable to the nose.
There is a light malt flavor no hint of the hops.  It might be said that the hops and malt balance each other.  
It is light and smooth.  This is a beer you can drink all day which is good considering how much of it I have!  Think I’ll sit here and catch up on some other reviews.
Got this on tap. Maybe it had turned bad but this beer was no better than drinking a regular old bud. Will give it another try if i can find it in bottle
One could drink gallons of this stuff.  Sample was quite fresh with a pleasant nose and nice light malt flavor.  If only our macros were like this.

Bottle--I just didn’t like from the first moments of opening to the end.  The aroma was rotting grass, lawn clippings.  The pour came with a fizzy, large head that disappeared.  The color was golden yellow and the taste had some carmamel and maybe honey.  A pretty typical below average brew.
This is a very premium lager. I would condsider this a great session beer. great clear straw color and a nice hoppy taste which goes down very smooth.
Not one of my favorites. Pours yellow with a thin, white head that soon fades. A little on the skunky side. Maybe itdoes age well in export?

bottle - This beer isn’t bad, but could certainly be better.  It pours a yellowish gold with a thin head, fading head.  The taste is somewhat sweet with a mildly bitter finish.  The carbonation is lively and the mouthfeel a bit thin.  It has a better flavor than most American macros probably because they at least avoid using rice or other bad additives.
Bottle.Bright gold in colour,medium head,aroma of light malt,taste is watery and floral with some malt,bitter finish.

Pours with a rocky white head that quickly dissipates and it looks like glass of chardonnay.  Aroma is sweet and a little skunky.  Flavor is rounded and malty with only a slight bitter hop taste that you find in heineken.  Altogether, not that bad.  Texture is dominated by carbonation and you don’t want to savor it in your mouth because of the sting.

On Tap at  Flying Pie on Fairview: Clear pale gold in color with lots of bubbles and a small fizzy white head.  No aromas really and the flavors are light at best.  But, it does have some - its like a richer version of Coors Light.  Not bad for an everyday dortmunder/helles???
Very surprised by this brew after tyring the Optimater. Didn’t expect an American-style lager. Poured very yellow with a small white head. Lightish lager with a bit of zest to it.
Great beer. Well water made to give it tha special zing. Wish I could afford it because I would stock up on it and forget about all the rest of the beers. lol
This is the first bottle from a Spaten sampler pack. I hope thinks get better. Pretty unremarkable other than an slightly odd tart taste that I can’t quite identify.

With a good pour, the head was still overwhelming.  Rocky head - smells like American beer to me, and it looks about the same.  Taste was ok, very tart.  Not the best Spaten - Try Oktoberfest for the same price.
On Tap as Spaten Helles.  Eggshell, rocky head.  Aromas of malt and light hops.  Very lively on the tounge.  Flavours of hops, yeast, and malt.  Residual of butterscotch.

Bottle from Plaza Liquors - Pours a clear light golden color with a small white head that fades to nothing pretty fast.  Flavor is grain malt and light grassy hops.  I’d group it with all the rest of the pale European lagers.  Worth a try.
Pours a clear golden yellow color.  Aromas of grass, cheerios, and a touch of flowers.  Flavor is kinda sweet to start, citrusy finish with some hop notes.

Bottle at home (040123).
Pale golden with a small white head. 
Aroma and flavor light to moderate malty/sweet and hoppy/bitter. Light body, watery, lively carbonated.

I didn’t find this beer as pleasurable as the fellows before me. It poured a darker amber color. Sweet hops were mildly present in the aroma along with a little foot.  I got it in a 5L keg, it did the trick for the night, but not something I want to drink again.
Skunky aroma. Body is somewhat watery, and finish is sweet. not bad, but not thrilling either. A very small step above drinking a heineken.

12oz bottle pours pale golden with a small creamy white head that hangs on about 1/8th of an inch and laces a little on the way down the glass.  Aroma is of light hops and light grains and a bit of skunk as well.  Flavor is much better than the aroma. Sweet bready notes, some yeast and light german hops.  Palate is light and airy with just enough carbonation to make this feel decent in the mouth..  It definitely isn’t up there with the Great Lakes Dortmunder Gold but it is fair to drink and not bad.  Close to average..

5L minikeg:  Pours a slightly hazy deeper yellow color with an uneven, soap bubbly, white head.  Aroma is strongly fruity sweet.  Flavor is of butterscotch candy and grape juice.  Some alcohol, but the palate is mostly watery, very light body.  Not a bad lagerbeer.  The sweetness gets to be a little tiresome though.
From 5-Liter mini-keg. Fruity, sweet malty aroma. Slightly cloudy, pale golden. Taste is light, slight hint of candy or butterscotch, light-medium bodied.

Pale straw color with a decent white head that slowly fades away.  Aroma of sweet malt, a bit of hops and slightly skunked.  Very nice malty flavor with a quick hop finish.  Full bodied.  Enjoyable  lager beer.
Light in aroma and flavor.  When comparing this to Great lakes dortmunder, it was evident where this beer stands.  Not very impressive.  maybe my batch was past it’s prime.
Very refreshing.  More flavorful from the bottle than tap in my experience.  Nice, but not overstrong maltiness, incredibely drinkable.
Good stuff. Crisp, clean, no monkey business. Holds up well to the cold. You can drink a few and not get too blasted.

12 oz. bottle.  Pale yellow with some head that faded right away.  Not much on the aroma front.  Some bland malts maybe.  Flavor was a bit better.  Some sweetness.  Not anything to get too excited about.
Not outstanding in any way, I am puzzled that Protz included this in his 300 beers book. I tried the draft version, maybe the bottled one is less dull.
Bottle. Very faint malt aroma. Pours light gold with a thin head and active bubbles. Taste is malty and light. Thicker mouth feel than I expect out of a lager. Very refreshing summer beer.
Light, crisp and German.  Still, it seems a tad more flavorful than, say, Warsteiner.

[draft at MacGregor’s - Rochester, NY] Pale straw color with a thin white head. Very light aroma of hops, malt and hay. Not a bad taste to it. Lots of grains and hops with a touch of dough and a light hoppy aftertaste. Not too terrible.

(Bottle) Big white head on pale yellow body. Some lacing. Nose is sweet, doughy, slightly skunky. Mouthfeel slightly watery, a little biting. Pretty smooth, refreshing. Taste is clean, a little smoky, a little sweet. Pretty nice.
very basic lager, not much going on here. on tap @ the saucer, they recommended it as "the ultimate starter beer for lite drinkers" or something like that... ok
This beer tastes and smells like marijuana!  HOLY CRAP!  I love everything about it.  Really goes great with a joint!
For some reason pale lagers are quite satisfying after working up a sweat.  Straw-colored with white head.  Grassy aroma and taste.  Pleasantly bitter ending.  Not too bad.
(Bottle 50 cl) Comes as "Spaten Münchner Hell". Very pale golden with a small head. Light-bodied with a sweet, malty character and only a weak bitterness. Quite a sympathetic beer. 051200

I am shocked that I have never rated this, one of my standard beers. On tap at the Huber Haus and best consumed wherever by mas. Classic golden color with a bountiful white head. When at its coldest, the aroma is fresh, hoppy and straw-like. As the lager gets warmer, you get a slight tinge of the butt-like scent from the german lager yeast. Not unpleasant, just a bit taken back, so to speak. Remarkably smooth palate with a fantastic hop/malt complement. When I was in Munich, the locals were amazed that their hometown bier was sold in an outpost like Omaha, Nebraska. An astonishingly solid product that is about as refreshing as you will find in a light lager. If only the Macros of this country could replicate this...
Bottle.  Light golden color with a nice white head that disappeared quickly.  A hoppy aroma, and a crisp, refreshing flavor.  This one was pretty good.
Bottled.  Crystal clear, pale yellow color with a frothy white head.  Skunky hop aroma.  Sweet and malty but tastes light-struck.  I will have to re-rate at some point.

Mini keg. Light golden color with a small white head. Malty, grassy aroma and flavor with a touch of hops on the finish.
A bit thin, but a pleasant, easy drinking beer.

Bottle, 33cl. Pale yellow colour. Fine white head, rapidly diminishing. The aroma is mainly hops with hints of malt. Not bad. Taste is again hops, dry and bitter. A classic one! But not quite my type...
Clean glassy yellow with a thin head.  Aroma is grassy wheat with a touch of vegetable.  Flavor is decently hearty, simple and boring though.

Bright gold with a large head full of tiny white bubbles.  Aroma is unexceptional, with the sweetness of the malt dominating.   Pretty average right down the line, from the carbonation and taste, right thru to the finish.  Nothing bad and nothing to gush over.

Almost a twin of the Schloss Eggenberg Pils I just had, clear Gold, foamy White head and same skunky aroma (same trip in same Green bottle!) This is the German Muncher Hell variety. A bit sharper that the previous brew,. Fresh cut grass, earthy. A crisp hop front with a nice malty middle, slightly bitter finish. A decent Helles.

Pours pretty nice.  Aroma and taste are kinda what you might anticipate, good lager to have around for an August BBQ in Texas.
Just enough hops at the finish to cut meat flavors but not so much as to affend your "regular beer" drinkn buddies!
Pleasent and refreshing are the two best descriptors.  Clean finish too.  No real complaints to be had here.

on tap-pours a thin to disappearing white head, color is clear yellow.  Taste is a mild grain with a light bite.  Thanks Bainy from The Jersey Old Stars, for the round at Alpine Cellar at the Lake Placid/Saranac Rugby Tournament last weekend.
Nice and deep. Plenty of pleasing malty goodness coupled with a brisk, fruity hoppiness. Clean and refreshing.
a nice golden color,especially when served on tap,with a pleasant,easy finish.
(bottle)  Poured a a light golden colour with an average head and some lacing.  Nice bitter hops and lasting taste.  Smooth, well balanced real beer.
pour pale golden with a large white head, aromas of hops, fruit, citrus, and earth, the taste is carbonated, citrusy, and a little bitter, not bad, smooth and drinkable.

9 May 2005 - Hop aromas with some earthy malt and low fruit aromas.  Clear yellow colour with good suds lacing.  Sweet malt hop flavour with a hint of earthy aftertaste.  Medium mouthfeel that finishes as a clangy hop aftertaste.  Overall - Easy drinking but doesn’t quite pass for me.

Bottled.
PAle golden, large white head.
Fresh aroma with hops and metal.
Fine bready, sweet maltiness.
Very fresh.

Aroma has a sweet smell with yeast. The color is golden and has at least an average head for the style. Flavor is pretty good. The hops are not too bitter and its buttery and you can definitely taste the yeast. Its a little sour too. Malt aftertaste. Not my favorite but overall its good.
Pours gold with a very large head.  Has a strong pure hops smell.  Not much in the flavor department, flat and smooth.

This beer just does not do well vcoming over the pond.  The long wait before we get to drink this out of the keg is too long.  The color was fine but the taste is flat and needs more of a kick.  Good but not real good.

This is a completely undistinguished beer. The only notable thing about it is that it is VERY pale. Disturbingly so. Overly carbonated, with a large head. Flavor is kinda skunky, with a slight hop finish. Kinda boring, but not bad.

Wow, for a beer with malt liqour written on the side, this is not bad.  Looks like pee though.  What makes this style of beer unique? I couldn’t say, but this beer could potentially be good if they keep working at it.

Poured from a 12 oz. bottle, no head after a minute and only minimal lacing like many American lagers. Good carbonation in my mouth (kinda ironic given the lack of head). Aroma is on the skunky side. Flavor is dominated by bitter/sour hops and was also somewhat skunky.
Ths is fairly good.  Flavor is full of malt, some lightly bitter hops.  Sampled from a mini keg.  Aroma is simple with some hops.  The beer is gold, with a small head.
My least favorite of the spaten’s I’ve had, not because it tastes bad, but because it doesn’t have enough flavor.
A golden body with white head. Has a fruty aroma.Some hint from banana. Also a fresh taste. Soft bitternes in the end.

Aroma: pilsener like aroma with a little peppery and honey notes. Appearance: clear pale golden yellow foamy head with no lacing. Flavour: lighlty sweet almost melony fruit. Palate: thin with some lingering bitterness.

Yellow with white head.
Malty with notes of forest, hay, rubber and muesli.
Malty flavor with notes of vegetables. Dry with decent bitterness. Sweet.
Bottle. Pale gold with white head. Smells of sour mash and toilet water. Watery, bitter, wet cardboard taste

Nice golden color with a decent amount of frothy white head. Aroma if of bread and maybe some foot funk. Tastes like malt with some sweetness, finish is bitter yeast. Mouthfeel is carbonated. Nothing really special here.

(bottle) Golden colour with a big frothy white head. My first impression after having filled my glass was a stench of pure urine but fortunately it turned into a smell of sweet malts, cookies and some grassy hops. Moderate sweet flavour, medium body. Malty taste with hints of honey and a smooth but bland hoppy finish with a slight bitterness.
Golden, small dissaåearing white head. Mild hoppy aroma, hints of bread and vegetables. Soft malty flavour with mild grassy undertones. Rather bland finish.
It has a meduim body with a wonderfully smooth after taste. This is a good diner beer
Decent beer in the Helles style, more or less.  Nothing remarkable.  Weak appearance and pour. Mild hoppy aroma and flavor. Much better choices abound.
Had this at a sidewalk biergarten outside the main university in Munich.  Its just okay.  Better were the conversations I was overhearing, remarkably one in English.

Tap.  Poured a golden yellow with a healthy 1+" creamy head that stayed rather well.  Aroma contained some hops and musty wheat.  Crisp clean mouthfeel with medium carbonation.  Flavor had some sweet malts in it, and the finish had some moderate hops and some dry grass or wheat.
Dense and adherent foam, discreet persistence. Shining, effervescent and limpid yellow color. Medium and pleasant scent; light malt notes. Herbaceous and lightly crisp taste.
Hop malt sweet floral honey aroma. Crystal clear yellow colour that looks likt it’s been through someone. Hop malt light flavour with a BLAH at the end. Fizzy palate.
Ok for a lager but not choice. Light gold color with some malty aroma. Catching a bit of sweetness. Would drink again if free.
Tap.  Nice malty aroma.  Clear golden yellow color.  Slightly sweet malt flavor with mild hops finish.  Quite enjoyable.
Bottle. Clear amber color with an average white rocky head. Aroma and flavor was average with a medium sweet finish. Drinkable but below average for style.

Bottle. Man, I can smell the skunk from 4’ away. Nice fat white head on a clear golden lager. Some malt undertones once you get past the initial stench. Thin in body with a mild but unpleasant bitter finish. Grassy and grainy in flavor with some malt and citrus.
Gold colored with aroma of pale malt, some hopcit.  Decent taste of hops and some pale malt coupled with slight apricots.  Finishes pretty crisp and smooth.

On tap at Mader’s.  A little deeper in the clear/translucent yellow color than Spaten’s Pilsener, but both are very similar in appearance.  Nice creamy, smooth head, a little smaller than the pils.  Smells like dog shit; muddy, barely identifiable sweet cake.  Taste is crisp, clean and lemony, much brighter on the palate than the pils.
