I would think this would be a high-selling beer in the states because it’s their most non-controversial beer.  Very similar to some US macro renditions.  Pretty uninteresting.  Definitely not my style.

The bottle poured a light golden sparkling clear liquid with an ample white creamy head. The head lasted nicely leaving lots of lacing. The aroma is of sweet malt balanced nicely with the hops. The flavor starts off smooth, and light with malt sweetness. The middle begins to hint at the hop bitterness and the finish is crisp, dry and nicely full of hop bitterness.
Bottle: Pale golden; very long lasting firm froth; typical mixture of malty, bitter and sweet notes; smooth; one of the better examples of  the often boring"Münchener Helles"-style

At first glance, this beer was skunky, uninteresting, and unappetizing.  However, I grew to thouroughly enjoy this beer, much as I do most dortmunder/helles selctions.  Great, grisp, clean flavor, to this one.  Truly a treat for a warm spring day!

Wow, what a disappointment this was!  I suppose I could have looked at the rating before buying the beer, but what fun is that, anyway?  Well, the beer came in a green bottle, and tasted to me like it had been in it for about a year.  This was the skunkiest beer I have ever had, and it was terrible.  My advice is to avoid this stuff like the plague.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Weak hop aroma and a light sweet hoppy light bitter taste. Medium body and alight sweet bitter dry finish.
bottled, actually a very decent lager.  it has little aroma and a sweet body.  it finishes w/ a slight hop bitterness.
Bottled. Yellow colour, mediumsized white head. Not much aroma, mainly hops with some grassy notes. Hoppy flavour along with malt. Late hoppy bitter aftertaste. Mouthdrying.

Nose is slightly sweet and malty along with grain.  Gold and visible through but some haze has started to develop.  Flavor is grainy and has some grass in it with moderate sweet malt.  A beer thats a normal beer. Enough said!
an alright beer from germany. not as good as some of the other german imports but a decent beer notheless. nothing special taste is normal

One of those beers you make a visit to every once in a while.  Bottle from brickskeller.  Crisp, light, night slight malty character, with a drier finish than I remember.  Nothing to amaze the senses, but pretty drinkable, and one of the classic german lagers, IMO.
Wow what a disappointment. I am glad it was part of a mixed 6, so I only have to try one. Corn flavor. Skunky aroma.

a great beer, very easy to drink. 
 a very reasonably priced,  worth a try!
A fair lager - light yellow color, very clear with a foamy head.  Flavor is fairly malty, with a bit of lemon and metal, and a slight twinge of hops.
Pale yellow, foamy top.  Did not care for the flavor that much.  At times, tasted like a mouth full of pennies, which I am not a fan of.  Seemed average everywhere else.
Pours a light golden yellow, nice thick head. I can really taste the hops in this one. Good carbonation and the taste is balanced. Nice lager, slightly tasty bitter palate. A good lager.

Light gold pour with good white head that fades quickly.  Nice grassy aroma with a little bit of hops.  Well carbonated, decent balance of malt and hops in the flavor.  Bitterness in the finish.  Not bad, but I would hate to consider it my specialty.

Pint, on tap at American Flatbread in Burlington.  Quite clear pale gold, little head...light grassy/sweet nose, touch of honey and dry herbs but fairly weak...flavor is just not there, quite wet and drinkable but ultimately quite boring, rather thin, touches of caramel and honey just don’t cut it.

Bottle. Brilliant pale gold with a short lived white head. Plenty of coarse bubbled carbonation. Mostly grainy aroma with a hint of skunkiness(green bottle). Smells clean and fresh. Flavor is not as fresh, sweet malt with noticeable grassy, almost lemony hop flavor at beginning. Fades to a quick moderately bitter finish. Really just a quick drinking refresher, not an overly interesting beer. But if you are looking for complexities, WRONG beer style to be fishin’ in. Desciption says this beer is our specialty-obviously specialty and "best" have nothing to do with each other.

Nice clear golden with a thick white head. Aroma of grain and some lemon. Pretty sweet and malty with notes of grain, lemon zest, citrus and a solid dose of hops. Moderately bitter aftertaste. Crisp and refreshing. Medium body but full and round with lively carbonation. Spider web lacing and good head retention. Overall, solid stuff.

Mine was in a green bottle...not a fan of this one.  Gross metalic finish after a decent initial hop flavor.  My experience sure doesn’t gel with everyone elses ratings...but I can only speak my experience.

light’golden colour low grade compared to spaten optimator..they should lower the cost it was 8.99 for a six pack should be 5.00 bucks not that good of a quality beer for that price but like all of us here we are trying new beers so we could climb the latter.

Light golden/yellow hue with a nice foamy head.  Probably not the freshest bottle but it has that characteristic Munich flavor.  Grainy and lightly hopped  Definitely some oxidation going on.  Pretty decent and clean.   At the right time and place this is an enjoyable beer.

Bottle:  Skunk aroma hit the air the second the cap came off.  Wish I had that brown bottle in the picture, it may have helped.  Instead I got the green one.  Aroma is kind of a skunky malt apple.   Pours a light gold with a decent white head that lasts a minute or so.   Very little up front with light malt and bitterness in the finish.  Easy drinking and more of a thirst quencher than a really enjoyable beer.
very typical lager-- average grassy stinky aroma of european hops, with a  typical malt and tangy hops flavor.  one of the better european lagers, but definitely nothing special.
Bottle.  Gold in color with white, long lasting head.  Grassy flavor with a very distinctive and pleasant odor.    Well balanced, and quite nice to drink.  Better than Heineken by a long shot.

poured a light gold w/ a thin white head and lots of carbonation, scent was a hint grassy but very light (bar) the palate was very plain nothing impressive.  The flavor was a bit earthy w/ hints of malts but fairly light overall.. overall it wasn’t bad.. I could drink it again.

Really not much in terms of aroma, but it came out of the bottle with a gorgeous white head that was so creamy it looked like redi-whip.  I had this bottle right after a Stella Artois, and what a difference!  I know the styles are a bit different, but this beer had the balance down in the flavor.  This is what I expected from an imported lager.  Feels cool and refreshing on the way down, with just a bit of bitterness after you swallow.
Pale yellow, moderate white, bubbly head.  Skunk aroma as expected, with a little sweetness.  Has some sweetness and surprising amount of hops.  Watery.

Bottle poured yellow with no head .
Hoppy aroma ann taste with a metalic finish.
Kind of a  tastier alternative to Heineken.  If you don’t want a skunky Euro-lager, then this might be a good beer for you.  A little more of the hoppy flavor...pretty good.
Pale golden colour. Intense hoppy aroma. Slightly malty taste with a hopbitter finish. Rather on the hoppy side of Helles. Slightly creamy texture,  and somewhat smooth mouthfeel. Decent Helles.
Great cleansing lager.  Not too exciting but it is a Hell and it’s mean’t to be like that.  Slightly on the sweet side of the malt / hop balance.  Good extremely clean beer.

Poured a rather light gold with a substantial white head.  Aroma was light, but crisply hopped and slightly skunky.  Flavor was likewise very light, with a very refreshing blend of moderate hop bitterness and a sort of apple-like malt sweetness.  Light but quenching on the palate.  A good all-around lager, but not a favorite.
This beer was great after the first gulp but then quickly became below average.  There are many lagers that are much better then this.
crisp. Unoffensive easy drink. Spot of citrus lemon, refreshing. Malts so somewhat sweet and leads to bitterness in aftertaste. Better with stronger carbonation, have it on tap.

tap at the bavarian. sparkling golden with a fluffy fat white head. grainy aroma, grainy taste. butterscotch and caramel with a balance of bitterness. green tasting very raw flavors not necessarily in a bad way, but not in a good one.
Bottled-A very light beer that tasted pretty bland to me.  The last sip out of any bottle I’ve had always tastes very stale.
On tap- Pale yellow with a thin white head.  Aroma was sweetly malted.  It’s a sweet grainy flavored lager with a little bit of hop.  Fairly watery but decent.
Bottled. Pale gold yellow beer with thinnish head. Flatter sweet lager, some hops but a flabby malt. Flavour dissappears on the finish, which is as well I suppose.
Bottle. Sweet, yet strong, hoppy aroma. Thin white head. Pale straw-gold color. Flavor is lightly hoppy, with a strong bitter bite at the end and aftertaste. Carbonation is quite strong.

Strong, pleasant aroma like club soda with a twist of lime. Tall but brief head but ok lacing. Color is very light and sort of cheap looking, could pass for MGD (and unfortunately has the same gritty aftertaste). Taste might not possess the elements of a great connoiseur brew, but if you’re in the mood for a beer like MGD that packs slightly more of a punch, you should give this a try - if being overpriced is not an issue.
Straw yellow body, medium white head. Weak aroma of some malts. Crisp flavor, but quite thin, weak and watery.

This pours a nice golden color with a sizeable white head and good carbonation.  The aroma is mild, mainly of sweet malts.  The flavor is a good crisp malt with a hit of the hop bitterness in the finish.  S’okay.

Light golden coloured body with a frothy white head. Aroma of pale malt and little else. Light to Medium-bodied; Small fragrant hop character in the taste with more of an emphasis on good quality malt. Aftertaste shows some distinct malt character with a bubbly feeling throughout. Overall, a nice beer to try (although it is very common) and worth drinking. I sampled this beer on draught as ’Spaten Munchner Hell’ on draught on 07-June-2004 in Sydney, Australia at the Lowenbrau restaurant on ’The Rocks’.
Yellow color with a small white head.  Mild pale aroma.  Taste was thin and reminiscent of American pale lagers.  Thin watery body.  Very disappointing when compared to Spaten Optimator.
Good beer, I don’t know why it’s claseiffied twice here, but I will rate the one I know.

As Spaten Bière Blonde Premium, French packaging. Light malts, some sweetness, with decent hop profile. Clean and crisp aroma. Pale blond clear, effervescence, with foamy white lacing head. Medium watery body with medium carbonation. Starts rather bland, with mild malts and grain. Low acidity. Hops bitterness comes in at the finish, with decent bitter dry after. A decent lager.
Clear pale golden body with a white fully lasting head. Aroma is of soft hops and grainy malt. Taste is fairly light and easy to drink, malt with a mild hop bitterness.
Clear pale gold. Soft white head. Sweet, bready, biscuity, moderately hoppy aroma.  Light feel. Clean, crisp flavour w/ good balance.
This made a fellow student teacher throw up 6 hrs later after feeling fine, but I do not know how that happened.  Not a bad beer at all, but nothing special either.
Sweet hoppy aroma, light yellow, small white head. Mild hops with a tiny malt backing. Light bodied, fair.
Not a bad beer.  Light golden color and a so-so balance of flavor with a hint of sweetness.  The head dissolves quickly.  Nothing special.
Dumb presentation and poor nose. There is little head and the flavour is soapy. The balance is not all that prominent and presents with a too thin palate
1 Pint+ bottle. Another big effervescent head on a darker yellow drink. Light "beer" aroma. Yes it does taste like a sweet macro with hops and a hint of alcohol in the finish.

(12 oz bottle) Please tell me this beer is brewed for export only; If the Germans actually drink this shit, it'll be a huge blow to my perception of their demand for quality beer on an every day basis; It's better than the likes of Budweiser, but not by much; This beer is very light flavored, mildly sweet and grainy, lightly bitter, with a short-lived finish; The beer has a fairly well carbonated mouthfeel and is tangy on the palate initially; The vaguely sweet and grainy nose is pretty mild and not very enjoyable; Very pale yellow in color and crystal clear; The white head is quite small on the pour, quickly fading to a bubbly rim and small island of sheen in the middle; No lacing

Pours a clear golden color with a medium sized white head that quickly disapates. Aroma is of malt, slightly sour but not unpleasantly so. Flavor is sweet and malty with a slightly bitter hop finish and some yeasty, bready tones. A very nice beer.

Aroma is strongly hops, herbs and light fruity. Pale golden color, white head, good lace. Sweet, herbal, grass, light, bit dry finish. Bit too sweet and could use some bitterness but overall a very nice example of the style.

A light golden brew with a small white head with a straw/wheat aroma that just made you think refreshing thoughts. Taste was light and delicate with a nice light maltiness and a good hop bitter balance toward the end.
Malty, flowery urine-like aroma. Malty falvor with some hops. Floewery and a bit oily. Slight hopbitter and cologne aftertaste. Disappointing.
Pours a classic golden color. Sweet grain aroma with a hint of hoppiness. Good smooth poundable brew. Not a ton of flavor, but what is there is good.
Yellow-gold colour with a big but rapidly dimishing head.  Sweet with apple and honey malts.  Enough noble hops to balance. Decent helles
Airy white head, clear yellow body. Hops and flowers in the aroma. Same in the flavor, quite fresh and rather tasty but not the most interesting.
Yellow, thin head...not very carbonated...not very flavorful either...crisp and refreshing with a little hoppy finish...
Had out of a 5 liter "mini Keg" and was so good that I couldn’t stop coming back for more (eh not so good the next morning though). Well balanced Hells, perfect color and great creamy head.

This one pours a light gold with a diminishing white head and very light carbonation.  The nose is malty and slightly sweet.  There’s a lingering malty sweetness that becomes a dryness on the tongue with a light hop bitterness.  This is clean but also heavy.

I asked some regulars what was the wimpiest beer at Rich O’s and was told it was Spaten Lager. I had one of these to field-test it for my sister and it was indeed wimpy.  I wish I could think of a better descriptor.
Sigue la ley de pureza alemana. Fuerte. Sabor a Malta y bastante aroma. No muy Carbonatada, con espuma normal.

Bottle. Very light straw gold body with a thick loose white two finger head. Nose is skunky as all get out. First taste that jumps out is corn. Very strong adjunct taste. Very sweet with a cardboard like malty flavor. Mouthfeel is very watery. Finish is sweet and sticks to your tongue. This is just a little too sweet for me. Not an awful beer, but not a good one either.
A slightly sweet taste.  Otherwise your average euro lager, slightly better than most.  On tap @ the Essen Haus, Madison, WI.
Looks like an ordinary lager, but tastes somewhat nicer and fresher. Great summer beer.
From the Sharp Edge Beerfest an above average crappy european lager....maybe a helles,  but i wouldn’t come close to calling it that
Gigantic head even with a modest pour. No distinct tastes but hints of citrus and bitterness from the hops.

Had this one from a small keg.  Not too bad...very smooth palate.  Taste reminiscent of Ayinger Brau-Weisse, because it is so light and even...shall I say...sweet?  Looks nice too, with a good head--be careful pouring this one.  The head will catch up to you if you’re not to careful.  Definitely worth a try.

This is a fair European mass-produced lager. Although not as full or flavourful as Warsteiner, Spaten is about the second or third best readily available keg around here, really...with the exception of Warsteiner or Guinness I guess. Naturally, it tastes better from the keg than from the bottle. I know this without even having it from the bottle. It’s common sense.
watery gold body with a white head. Smells light malt, sugar, german hops, orange peel. Sweet clove taste, orange/lemon creme and malts. Decent beer.

Bottled (label: Spaten München, BB 11/2004)

Beautiful clear golden with decent white head, which is rocky and foamy, good amount of lace. Hoppy, a bit soapy aroma. Nice sweetish malty body with late hoppy bitterness. Easy to drink.
Pours yellow with a white head.  Has a light aroma with a nice light body flavor.  Overall a nice brew.

Pretty good example of a light lager. Golden caramel colored and easy to drink. Flavors not that complex but is smooth and full bodied. Aroma not really noticeable but I still like this beer and buy it pretty often.
Straw yellow, white head.  Grain and light floral hop aroma.  A little up front bitterness but quickly gives way to muted soft malt sweetness.  Light in body.
Not a bad lager, but not as flavorful or clean mouthfeel as Weihenstephaner. I find the malt, while distinctively German in taste and aroma, rather light, even for the style.

pale yellow color, clear, with a pure white head. Aroma is very faint, almost non-existant, a little yeasty. Flavor is, well, there’s not much flavor. It’s not a bad brew, its just not really there. It’s like the angel food cake of beer. You know your drinking something, but it doesn’t seem like anything is in your mouth.
Just a plain tasting pilsener to me, not bad, but not great.  A typical German tasting brew, somewhat light though.

(on bottle) "barley malt, hops, yeast and water": Reinheitsgebot in the making. Putting this baby to the test with home-made gravad herring, polish cumin sausage and ryebread, it came through marveless. Clean, white head, sharp golden color; it´s probaly not the best Dortmundner around, but´s it´s a prime speciment. Especially the non-existance of any acidy ending, was great.
(Tried it out with a pear in the ending, but that was a no-go. But then again who´s buysimported pears in Denmark, in may, and thinks it´s gonna be a good experince??)
Dark gold, thin white head. Citrusy, mildly spicy aroma. Crisp palate, lemon, some hop bitterness, and a dry finish. No "off" flavors. Not a bland as I feared.
Flat pale pilsner with a light sweetly hopped aroma, and a malty and slightly dry flavour.  Overall a slightly too sweet brew.
On tap, clear and light yellow, very crisp, noticeable hops throughout, with a wet mouth feel before a dry hopped finish.  Some chemicals and corn flavors involved, but okay nonetheless.

A red lager with medium weight. A hoppy taste, plesant and smooth. Leaves a clean finish with a slight aftertaste that can best be described as oakey.

This beer is thin on complex flavor, but is rather a smooth, clean beer. This is an easy beer to drink and it does not feel heavy. However, this is not a beer that you drink to "enjoy". 

However, I rate all beer based on "category" and I think this is one of the best choices available.

(Originally rated 9/10 in my notes)
Pale light lager, light but lacking a certain "crispness" that makes good ones of this style stand out. Not horrible, but not at all special.
A pale lager, pours with a foamy white head that disipates quickly.  A sweet, semi-hop flavor.  Not the best that Spaten has to offer, but a good beer none the less.

While not my favorite Spaten, it certainly isn't bad. In the days when I sold the stuff it was called "Spaten Light" which I liked because, well, this is my idea of a "light" beer. Confused many a dumbarse Texun. And to me it is almost TOO easy to drink.

Quite pale yellow color with a large, lacy head. Fresh, flowery, quite neutral aroma. Lightly malty, moderately hoppy and grassy flavor with a sweetish, oily finish and a mild, flowery-bitter, honey aftertaste. Light-bodied, smooth, refreshing palate, somewhat carbonated. A nicely balanced lager, but nothing very special. Very easy to drink in large quantities :).

Surprisingly unskunked. This beer was crisp, refreshing and easy to drink, but the overall flavor was a bit bland and neutral, save for some of the fruity sweetness. Mild hop bitterness only adds a bit of dryness to the finish. Average brew altogether.
For a readily available bottle of beer Spaten is acceptable in my book. Kindof skunky, slightly bitter. Hell.
Crisp clean flavor. Light yellow in color. Really good. Light beer. Distinct Malt characteristic. Good beer.
Pale gold in colour with a disappearing head.  Aromas are sweet grain and some yeast.  Flavours are also grainy and without much body.  Actually typical of the style.

Pours a clear golden yellow. Decent aroma with that distinct malt with a touch of honey like other helles. Flavor is a little bland, light body, hard carbonation, very clean and refreshing though. Not bad, nothing too special about it.

Pours a bright straw gold color, that is topped by a white thick head.  A spicy, grainy, sweetish, and grassy aroma wafts from my glass.  The taste is clean, lightly sweet with some accompanying grain notes.   This beer finishes with a bit of sharp bitterness, which is nice.  There is a hint of apple in the taste.  Pretty straight forward, half way decent beer.  Would definitely be good on a hot day.
Bright yellow beer with small white diminishing head. Not much malt presence, very light bodied. Hop bitterness in the finish. Decent beer but not much to crave.

Sparkling clear golden body toppped by a frothy white head that leaves surprisingly good lacing on the glass. The aroma is typical skunked green bottle european lager. Oxidized metal comes to mind. The flavor is very flat. Not terrible but not good either. A very one-dimensional malty semi-sweet flavor. There might be some hops in here but not sure. The body is medium light and the carbonation is actually not too bad, not nearly as fizzy as other euro-macros. Overall it is tolerable but not something that I would seek out again.
A little skunked and sour tasting. I thought it was a fluke, but I see others had the same problem. Light hop flavor with mild sweetness. Seems like it would have been good if not for the skunk.

Small white head. Slight malt and hops flavor. Very light overall. People tend to like this one as it has very little flavor overall. Slight skunkiness, however this is to be expected with any green bottle.
Smells skunky. Ordinary, average gold in color, with a small white head. Slightly spicy wheat flavor, but is nothing special. It's drinkable, but kinda bland and average.

I had heard a lot of good things about this beer, but it didn't really live up to my expectations.  It pours a pretty boring gold with a white somewhat lasting head, with no lacing to speak of.  It's aroma is very light, somewhat sweet and hoppy.  The taste is a nice spicy hops with a smooth dry finish.  Not bad, but not as good as I expected.
on tap munich:  pale yellow hue, with nice fluffy bubbley head.  crisp clean easy to drink. medium bodied. hint of bitter hops or spicy. sweet  malt finish. a good helles.

Yellow of course, with a decent sized white head. Aroma was a tinge skunky, like a Heineken, but the flavor did not match. Fairly sweet, like drinking a weak appletini with a slightly bitter finish. Light bodied and light on flavor, non-offensive but not very interesting either.
Bottled. Golden larger with largish white head. Smooth, smooth larger malts. Really nice larger. Crisp and refreshing, yet smooth and complete.
Yellow, with a quite nice white head. Aroma is malty, sweet and fruity from apples. Has a sweet flavor, and turns into some bitterness.

Bottle:  maybe a bit past its prime.  Starting to smell a bit skunked.  Looks and smells quite American Standard.  In fact, our local pub no longer sells ASs and offers this as their replacement "starter beer".  I do taste some malt and a pleasant roundness to the mouthfeel.  Prefer the draft version - or at least a fresh one.
This is not impressive. It reminded me a lot of Heineken, which is also not impressive. It was slightly bitter and very pale. Not my first choice in beer. I will pass next time.

Crystal clear, straw-colored lager with a medium-sized, frothy, white head. Diminishes to a small, creamy, well-retained head with great, weeping lacework.
The nose is skunky and metallic. The only thing pleasant about the aroma is a touch of lemon. Flavor is non-descript. Ultra light-bodied with fizzy carbonation. Short, dry finish. Not good!
Pours pale golden, light malt aroma. Lots of carbonation, crisp finish. Perfect lawnmower beer.
Although this beer comes from the same makers of Franziskaner beer this lager is mediocre at it best. Regular taste. Regular flavor. Regular aroma. Nothing extraordinary in it.

Surprisingly uninteresting.  Possibly Americanized?  Possibly just that lager does not travel well, and I had this one half way around the world from its home.  Slightly skunky nose, watery palate, average golden color with head that vanished immediately.  Tastes like a light beer with good hops.

A pretty head on a golden colored beer is all to be expected.  Average malt/hop aroma with a balanced flavor of hops and malt.  I'm sure this is much better on the other side of the pond where it would be tasted while fresh.

Pale gold, good head retention. Mildly malty aroma, not much though.
Flavour was slightly malty but had a tiny bit of sourness which was really inappropriate for mine.
Beaten out by Lowenbrau - hardly a ringing endorsement.
Clear and golden with a slight head. Clean malty aroma. Malty flavor with that big long malty finish that is typical in German beers.Quaffable, but not as good as Ayinger.

Yellow in color. Small white head. Has a decent maltiness followed by a slight sweetness. a medium hopping is present. Has a dry and almost citrus finish. Had a little more flavor than i was expecting. Not bad for the style.

Clear straw color with a small tight head. Aroma is malty and slightly toasty. Flavors are initially malty and sweet with subtle fruity hints. Finish is crisp and hoppy. Not bad, but not my favorite style.
On Tap: Pours a crystal clear golden with a frothy white head.  Mildly pale malty and hoppy aroma.  Body is smooth and semi-sweet with a crisp subtle hoppy finish.  A very nice and drinkable helles.
Bottle: Light golden colour, very freshing hoppy and malty taste. Well balanced and overall a great lager.
A very nice full flavor for a lager.  I've always liked Helles-type beers and this one fits the mold - a little bit plain, but some fruity flavors come through and redeem it.  Not bad.

Tasted exactly like a German beer. It could have been interchanged with 10 other kinds of German beer and you wouldn't know the difference - Beck's, Dab, etc. Not to say that this is a bad thing. If you like this style of beer, it's quite good. I could see myself drinking these all night.

I was surprised by this one.  i was expecting it to be gosh-darned awful, but it's pretty ok (heck of a lot better than that Pilsner Urkel i just had).  Big giganto yead on top of a cleary yellow beer.  "eh" aroma with a surprisingly full mouthfeel and refreshing quality.  a nice maltyness slowly seeps into the aftertaste.

Pours a very pale gold with little head that goes quickly.  Aroma is small, but there is some sweet malts and as said before a bit of bread in the beer.  Mostly malt hanging around the flavors. The bread effect comes about as well. Kind of an odd taste there at the end, not sure what I want to call it. Tangy, spice filled palate. Not too bad.
Crisp aroma with hint of breadiness. Mid-toned yellow topped with huge pure white head. Flavor is crisp and unobtrusive, but boring. Slightly bready after-effect.
I'd pretty much call this an ok beer - euro bud.  i won't be buying this again...
crisp,golden brew with a small head and a distinct flavor of hops,slighty buent aftertaste, otherwise nice beer
Golden color, white head. Lighter aroma, hoppy, some malt. Decently balanced malt/hop flavor. Nothing too special but very drinkable.

In appearance it looks like a 100 other German style light colored beers. Had a good head that dissapated pretty quickly.
Not a very strong smell at all unlike corn addled American macros..light and slightly hoppy.
Taste is pretty good though unexciting..maybe i shouldnt have eaten the slalmi before hand though :)
Nice feel around the tounge and the back of the mouth very nice.

Very easily to drink could see this as a good summer BBQ beer if i had the cash!

Very pale golden with hints of hops.  I can't say that this style inspires me very much, but Spaten does a decent job with it.  God Damn them to hell for not brewing Club Weisse any more.  Franziskaner just doesn't do it for me the way Spaten's Club Weiss did.
This light golden beer had a good clean taste and went down easy. Simple and nothing exciting but well brewed.
I was disappointed in this beer after having the Optimator and the Oktoberfest beers.  Tasted like an above average Bud or something like that.  Nothing impressive here.

Bottle. Pours brilliantly clear and sparkling gold with a large, frothy egg shell white head, long retention. Medium skunky light-struck aroma from mishandling, medium-high rich bready malt, medium-low spicy and floral hops, and very low corny DMS aroma. Flavor is moderate rich grainy-sweet malt with complex bready notes, light floral/herbal hops, light hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Medium-light body with moderate carbonation.

Very light yellow body, small white creamy head.  Earthy, grassy aroma with sweet malt.  Unfortunately it tastes slightly skunked (thank you green bottle!), but still pretty good with a grassy hop flavor and lively carbonation.

This is actually a really good brew.  Although I did not find the malty sweetness in the flavor as depicted.  The bottle has it labled as a malt liquor,but it is far from it.  Good flavor somewhat chewy texture.  I really enjoyed this one.

better then i expected, had a nice thin white head and a mundane yellow color.  It had a really smooth hoppy taste that was more floral than bitter, it finsihed really smooth.  The taste seamed mild overall, but good.
Light color with no head at all. Somewhat refreshing with its smooth taste. Some malt in the aroma. But overall a pretty average beer.
Bottled(500ml). -golden coloured, malty palate, well-balanced hop flavor, refreshing with good bitter finish
Clear, pale golden color.  I sampled this at Der Rathskeller in Indianapolis.  Smooth, almost flat taste.  Good pale lager.
Clear yellow color, short dying head. Typical pils aroma of hops, some grains. Smooth taste, grainy, hopbitter. Very nice german brew actually.
Light blond coloured lager, almost no palate and quite some carbonation. Bit hoppy and malty. Quite ok.

Sampled at the Ludwig's Garten Oktoberfest party in Philadelphia... Poured a dark golden color with not much of a head at all.  Malty aroma, with a slightly carbonated, skunky taste and a sticky mouthfeel.  It did leave a nice lacing, although this was a weak beer.
Golden light color. Very malty aroma. Semi-sweet flavor with hint of hops. Reminds me of a Grolsch. Not a very good well travleled beer. Still refreshing on a hot day.
The smell is horrible. Definite skunk malt liquor. The flavor is very light, as is the color. By drinking this beer without smelling you are doing yourself a favor.
Nothing special, but a smooth beer with a nice aftertaste.  Lots of head, but that can be reduced with a little nose greese.

Nice color and fluffy white head start off this one.  Aroma is fairly typical of the style.  Flavor lacks in any real distinctive character, and is fairly unremarkable...not bad, just not worth writing home about.  An average lager.
Golden straw color and medium head. Malty and bready aroma, some sweetish notes in the taste and good bitter finish.

Just the thing to put out the fire of that Golden Monkey I just had. Nice frothy white head out of the bottle, like beaten egg whites. The appearance is slightly lighter than your typical Pilsner. The flavor is well placed and very drinkable. Somewhat sweet on the finish. My kind of brew!
(on draught at The Bishops Arms, Göteborg)Pale golden with a steady head. Classic standard lager aroma and flavor of some corn, but still quite good. Slightly sweet and bitter.
hm.  tap, good beer, me and my buddy drank a pitcher of it, good shit.  best part is the finish after every sip.  easy to drink.

Keg. Spaten Münchner Hell
Blond color. Light bread and malt aroma. A residual sweetness; lacking of character and hop.

Aroma is lightly malt with large skunkness to it. Flavor is lightly hoppy with a light body. If only it weren't for the skunk this would be a good helles.ReRate (brown bottle):Aroma is much less skunky as before and is quite balanced now. I really enjoyed this crisp clean lager as a good malty finish of the night.
A very tpical very skunky lager, that is another one of those damn green bottles.  blah

Straw body with lazy carbonation and a clean white head. Aroma of buttery, nutty malt, fragrant hops, and sea water. Flavor of hop spice, flowers and some doughy malt. Crisp, easy palate, but a little spritzy. Lacks subtle depth of flavor, but a solid Helles.
Has the usual Eurolager look and smell (which isn't necessarily a bad thing.)  It tastes much better than Heineken or Beck's though.  Overall, a good and very drinkable beer.

looked as expected. plenty of sweet malt up-front and then some strange berry bitterness-tartness. a little water. as zieglerbrau helles on tap in dachau. typical sweet hay aroma. very pale with very light bitterness and a hint of raw sugar. standard helles made to seem a bit better by being very fresh
Very light golden color with a white head. The taste is light and fresh. Malts and hops, doesn't give enough taste in my opinion.

This can eat my pussy. If I want to buy Heineken I don't need to go to some swanky pub in the rocks. I hated this beer bad and had to ask if others wanted to finish my bottle. This beer hurt not only my tastebuds, but my feelings...

(bottled).  Brilliant pale gold with a grainy malt nose & noble hop aroma.  Medium bodied with a nice maltiness, moderate carbonation, and a pleasant hop bitterness that lingers and balances the maltiness to a slighly dry finish.  Perfectly balanced like the style demands and highly recommended!
Light golden colour. Quite sweet with a medium bitter finish. Decent body, but all in all nothing special.
Very good German beer. Nice head, tasty flavor. Nice, hoppy flavor for this style. I like it. It's quite good.

Classic golden color with a small white head that diminishes fairly quickly.  A steady stream of tiny bubbles keeps a thin foam at the top of the glass.  Rich lager aroma, malt, a bit of honey and floral hops.  Nice initial acidic pucker, malts well up to balance the middle then the hop bitterness returns for a lingering, slightly herby finish.  Light body buoyed by perfect level of carbonation.  Nice, drinkable German beer.
Very light taste, deceptively strong.  Nice clean flavor with a light touch on the hops.
Light gold in color, very nice aroma. Crisp and clean.  Very good balance of bitter and sweet.  Hops are delightful.
Light golden colour with good head. Mildly malty and hoppy. Quite crisp. A classic Bavarian Pilsener.

2003 draughtGotta keep in mind when drinking this, the aims of the brewmaster.  A light, good tasting german lager.  I was very happy with it when I took a chance and departed from my regular order of american light beers at the bar.  Great hazy straw color with the usual dissipating small white head.  Nice strong bite, actually has some fresh grainy taste and dosent die out and water down towards the end.  Maybe would like some more distinctive hops in the body, but then I might be wishing for a different type of beer.  
2004 bottle Another embarassing review by me above.  Dont know what I was getting at.  Perhaps trying to say that for a pale lager, this would be fantastic, if that’s what the brewmaster was shooting for, but rated against dortmunder/helles, this thing is practically flavorless water.  Only fleeting malt taste up front, with some light hops bite as it finishes.  No off-tastes, but nothing particularly on about it either.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white.  Body is light blonde with lively carbonation. Aroma is grassy & floral. Flavor is semi-sweet & moderately bitter. Finish is moderately bitter.  A very nice Helles.

Poured medium head with fine-small bubbles that quickly dissolved. There was not much lacing with this brew. There was carbonation observed rising to the top. It had a fruity, citrusy aroma to it. It was a thin and watery brew. The body was a light yellow. This brew reminded me too much of American mass-produced beers. This was disappointing.

This brew pours a medium head of fine to medium sized white bubbles and a transparent straw yellow lager colored body. It has a hoppy aroma with a fizzy initial, burp, taste and a hoppy slightly bitter acidic flavor that lingers well after it finishes. It left only a fair lacing. I expect better from Spaten the maker of one of my favorite Doppelbocks, but a s a lager, if you like them this one is just OK.
Bottled: Light yellow coloured. Not much head. Aroma is light hoppy and has some malty notes. Flavour is a little vague. Sweet and ends with some hoppy bitterness.

poured vom Faß at the Löwenbräu Keller by some guy in a blacksmith outfit for no apparent reason. at first light and fluffy with dry herbal hop flavour, then firm and chocolatey pale malt. you think the malt's never going to go away, then a little spike of crisp hops turns up. a very drinkable and pleasant lager, but a bit on the dull side. well balanced blabla. texture's nice and creamy.

A yellow beer with a fine head. The aroma is primarily hoppy but also malty - a very fresh nose. The flavor is sweet containing brewmash notes and a nice aroma hop. Very much like a good czech beer - very nice soft pilsener.
A classic German pilsener, in my opinion. A little bitter in the end, otherwise a bit too watery and thin.
It smelled pretty bad like moldy clothes or something, but the taste was amazingly smooth with no bitterness.  Overall I thought it was a decent brew.

Ya know, this was actually very good compared to what i was expecting. The bottle was green and the price was cheap so i feared the worst. But this actually turned out well...the aroma was the only scary part as hops and stale hops mingled with cold glass to form a strange grainy and skunky quality with a saving hint of malt. It pours with a total goldeny yellow with heavy carbonation and a quickly dissipating but initially thick soapy white head. The taste is very simple, flowing, and crisp...a nice simple hop flavor with a reinforcing malt undertone...very smooth and light with little underlying flavors other than those mentioned. Syrupy like hops and an almost wet ending..not the usual drying expected from a lager. Good mouthfeel, not overwhelming...simple but effective lager which is put together surpisingly well.

One of my all-time favorites.  A great lager that goes well with practically anything.  Smooth on the taste buds and a terrific after taste going down.  Easily one of the best imports I've ever tried.
Straw gold color with an even large white head.  Slight skunk, light straw odor.  Light ,clean, smooth.  A good import pils.
A good crisp beer on par with Hansa and St. Pauli Girl......................
Typical lager and nothing really special. Golden color with a lemon flavor. Decent body and a crisp taste. Overall a pretty good lager but nothing I would really go out of my way for though.

Wow, that's pale, good carbonation, a thin white head.  VERY clean & crisp, hints of corn and flaked barley.  Super crisp, a pleasant drink, well balanced, bu tsubdued in every character.  It is a good interpretation of the style.  I think I could drink about 15 of these.
Slight hop nose, lighter golden color, white head. Nicely balanced, smooth, and easy drinkin'.

Brilliant gold color with a lasting white head.  Sweet malty aroma with just a faint hint of hops;  Also has a little bit of corn(DMS) in the aroma, but clean otherwise, no fruity esters.  Very well malt balanced with a slightly sweet finish with a little bit of DMS(corn) in the background.  Carbonation lightens the mouthfeel of a medium bodied lager, very smooth otherwise.  Overall an easy drinking beer, not terribly complex, then again lagers aren't supposed to be.  Very enjoyable as a session beer.

the clear, light golden body supported a very long lasting and firm white head.  the aromas escaping this head were grainy with the slightest touch of hop aroma at first but the hops started to get stronger as i sniffed.  at first this was a very malty (not rich or sweet just malty) but then that was interrupted by crips hop flavor in the middle.  not much bitterness percieved from those hops.  it finishedwith more malt and fairly clean.  the smoothness of the medium body was surprising considering the moderately high carbonation.
This is a classic German lager. A nice head with a golden body. It is a very smooth drinking beer with a great after. This met all my expectations.This is my favorite Munich big six lager.

Good as far as the type goes. Nice, clean, slightly malty aroma.  A pretty golden color in the glass, smallish head.  Mouthfeel is a little thin.  Taste is crisp; on the whole not bad at all.   Good beer for a dinner involving beef, or a buffet.

Very pale golden, almost clear. Quarter inch ring of head is present for the whole glass. Sweet malt and a mild hint of hops in the aroma. Up front, there is a crisp carbonated bite on the toung. It gives way to bready malts with an ghost-of-a-hint of citrus. Spicy hops in the finish round out this excellent Helles.

Nice aroma although a little skunky. Taste resembled Beck's which i don't mind although that skunk taste/smell can be a bit much at times. Finishes a little cleaner than Becks however. Tastes slightly watered down also.
Too watered down for me. I might as well be drinking a Hurricane...but I like the packaging. I guess that counts for somthing.

Green bottle, but not skunked. It pours a clear, golden yellow color with a small, lingering head. The aroma is slightly malty with a typical lager sweetness. Light bodied, with a nice malty sweet flavor and a crisp, hop finish. The flavor seems to turn more bland as you drink more of it. This is a fairly tasty lager, smooth and easy to drink.
Had on tap.  Seemed a little watered down.  Nothing to really grab your mouth and tell it there is beer inside.
Pretty good. I used to work for a man that was from Austria and he would only drink Spaten and Yuengling Lager. Slightly skunky and it's light. A little too light for my taste.
Nice looking European light lager with the typical slightly airy, malty nose.  Just a hint of the import skunk we get in America, but still a pleasant enough mellow, refreshing lager.

I'm off and on with this beer.  Bought it yesterday because it was 80 degrees here in La Mesa.  Tastes better drinking it out of the bottle rather than pouring it in a glass.  Slightly skunky with malty flavors.  Well balanced.
I really didnt' like this beer from a bottle.  Much better and less skunky coming from a tap.  I prefer Spaten Optimator from this brewer.
Solid Helles, not as good as Paulaner though.  But saying that it is still good.
Nice light gold color.  Not too hoppy, balanced well with the malt.  Very clean light lager.
Light color but strong flavor with light aftertaste.........................
A good lager: fresh, malty and clean taste. Much better if drunk on tap.....
Decent aroma led me to believe this would be a great one.  But the promise is lost.  The beer tastes watered down, balanced, but nothing more than a good macro.
Golden yellow hue.  White head.  Herbal hoppy nose.  Very light bodied, hops are subtle, nice maltiness with fruity apple like finish.  A decent drinkable brew.

The Beer Hunter describes this beer as "notably aromatic; with a clean, quite sweet, malty palate; and a late, light, nutty dryness."

I found it to be very crisp and light on the palate, with a delicate sweet maltiness. The nose is fragrant but not strong. The finish is long and dry.
Nice rocky white head and golden yellow body.  Brings back fond memories of Germany but its difficult to put this light beer in a bottle and expect it to be good months later.  Not too bad.

Average German lager.  Nothing special.  Very bitter finish,
and light malty flavor.  Has tinge of pine taste.  Otherwise,
ordinary.

this is a good one for the Swill drinkers to start out on, training wheels for crap beer drinkers, I would say.Tastes better than it looks, decent head, nicely balanced,a good choice for someone trying, or wanting to get away from macros,keep it in your beer fridge for times when someone comes over and asks for a Bud,BudLite,Miller, etc.
Golden appearance, decent head, sweet and malty aroma. Decent hops finish...

Pours a ultra clear very pale yellow with a 3-finger head that shrinks to a nice lumpy layer. The smell reveals an earthy grain with black pepper spicing. The taste is a lightly sweetened malt of earthy tones and the hops that are in the aromas are not apparent in the taste. Very, very mild hopping...perhaps under-hopped. It is a very pleasant taste despite the lack of bite. It is a light bodied brew with just a light sticky-sweet mouthfeel and drinkability is quite high for this one. Prosit!

Respectable lager, considering how easy it is to find on tap in the US.
Fruity, hoppy aroma, with a well-balanced flavor
and finish.

This beer poured a light gold color and formed a nice white head that left some lace. Some light carbonation present. The aroma was of hops and touch of lemon. The flavor was of hops and a little lemon. The finish was a bit astrigent and had a bit of citrus to it. Not bad for a session beer, but there are better ones out there.
Very Good Beer!! I loved it. something you could just slam down fast. nice and smooth and very refreshing!!

transparent yellow with a white top..smelled like a lager..tastes like a lager that someone spilled a shot of apple juice in..finishes sort clean but sorta sweet...and i'm sorta bored already...so I'm out..Peace!

A classic -- the original Helles, and still the best I''ve ever tasted. Though Helles isn''t my favorite style, there''s something great about a beer that can be enjoyed by the Mass at the Waldwirtschaft, Taxisgarten, Siebenbrunn, or a host of other Munich Biergartens. The aroma is of noble hops layered over malt; it''s a foreshadowing of what''s to come when you actually taste it.
Light gold in color.  Small white head with decent lace.  Light body and taste.  Finish was clean.

Sheesh. If I am going to drink with a cold, it better be for good beer.  This completely sucked. Blonde with a froth head and an alcoholic sugar aroma, this beer was indistinguishable to me from a baltic style pilsner--somewhat cloying, unbalanced, corn syrupy flavor and bland. No distinguishing/redeemable qualities.  
Addendum: Crap!!!! I was just reminded--this was my 500th rating!!! What a freakin' let down! Whatever

Solid straw color with a bright white head grasping the glass as you quaff.  Aroma of mild hops and malt.  Sweet light malt in the flavor with just enough bitterness not to make it stick.  Very nice and drinkable lager. This could be an everyday beer for me.
Tap.  A light body.  Some perfume champagne like qualities.  Easy drinkin''.
Huge overflowing pillowy head. Illuminous gold color. Perfume and hop aroma with crystal malt undertones. Bitter hop and quiet malty flavors. Light bodied. Crisp clean finish.
Not a whole lot of flavor to it but it went down smooth. too much money to spend on something that tastes so domestic.
A nice German beer. Easy to drink, crisp, refreshing........................
THis had a really "soft" thick fluffy palate - did not like that aspect of it.  Very slightly skunked - aroma/flavor. Otherwise, it was balanced and nice.
Not bad; from the bottle on a work break at the conference I was attending. Good lagerish mouthfeel, decent malt, touch hops.
Golden; firm body, crisp, decent hoppy depth.  .............................

Can 500 ml 

Aroma: clean sweet Munich malt with slight flower hints. True and clean , maybe bit subdued. 7- 

Appearance: bright golden , crystal clear with lighter white top. 3+
Flavour/Palate: soft mid light bodied. Clean , no off flavours. Straight Munich malty base with gentle herbal bittering on top end. Simple yet done properly.
Very enjoyable.  Went down easy with a slight hops aftertaste.  ............

Light gold color, small head. A light bodied lager. Slightly hoppy and mildly malty. Nice flavor, somewhat fruity. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. Light and refreshing

Clear light gold with white head--clingy lace...Aroma hoppy/grassy but pleasant...Lightness abounds in this brew, but it isn't water-thin...Slightly sweet bottom and mild hop bitters in full harmony--carbonation (thankfully) kept under control...Finishes quite cleanly and evenly...body is just about right for this style...It is nice to know there are lagers you can rely on when you want one...
Not too shabby....not too shabby at all.....................................
Really enjoying this beer... skunky, but very tastyt and pleasant... leaves a nice feeling of drinking a well-made beer.
The classic quaffable Munchner Helles.  I've had samples vary widely, but at its best it has a perfume-like nose, full light-malt body and flavor and a gentle drying finish.
Wee bit skunky - good pour with thick head and good lace.  Very weak finish - was that a beer going down my throat? Probably be a good beer to drink a lot of at Oktoberfest.

Very little aroma or head, the flavor kinda disintegrates in the mouth before swallowing.  I'm now convinced that Reinheitsgebot is a sixteenth-century marketing ploy.  I see no reason to have more than one of these.
Definitely has a helles nose, light straw color, small head. A bit perfumy, malt accented, not much bitterness. A tad watery. Nowhere near as good as Hacker-Pschorr's helles.
very bland lager.  slight smell of a german pils.  Light malt and hop flavors.  Not my beer and not my style.
A fairly ordinary German lager.  Somewhat dry with a hint of sourness.  Essentially no aroma.

My wife asked what I thought of this one. I said, "Try to imagine what Coors would be like if it were actually a good beer." She looked puzzled, so I passed her the glass. She tasted it, looked thoughtful for a moment, and replied, "You're right."

Thin light beer from Germany.  Most of these do not survive the trip across the ocean.  If you get to The Fatherland someday, you will find that these beers are light and crisp and refreshing.  Here, they are skunky and sour.  It is the green bottles and I think the preservatives.  Maybe.
Hop aroma. Golden with greenish hue. Malty honeyish taste, well balanced with hops.

Opened it up and it started pouring/foaming out everywhere. It had been in the refrigerator for days. Got it into a glass and it looked okay. Still maintained a head throughout after all the initial problems. Kind of tasteless though. Not a bad lager at all, just don't need to pay too much for this kind of beer here in the southwest.

A solid, genuine German beer, meaning real ingredients.  Pretty standard and straightforward for the style, so nothing unusual to report on.  In all fairness, I don't know if I could tell this apart from Warsteiner, so I'm rating it just the same as I rated that.  I had it on draft because I don't trust the green bottles.
In the same class as Bitburger and Warsteiner.  ............................

for someone who does not like lagers I  though this was quite good.  nice and crisp with some flavor.

An ideal hot day's drink
Probably my favorite lager.  Well-balanced hoppy w/ a slight sweetness.  This is how a lager should taste.  Not a beer for the dark beer lovers, but good for anyone who likes a lighter brew.
One of the better lagers out there.  Big head, almost clear golden color.  Slight skunkiness that they did a good job keeping a lid on.  Clean and refreshing though not remarkable.
Great german lager.  full of flavor.  no nasty aftertaste.  ................

Definately the worst European beer I have ever had the misfortune of tasting.  This beer is poor.  Don't even bother trying this.  It is very watered down, skunky, and tasteless.  Reminded me of 3 month old watered down pabst blue ribbon.  Yuck!
Yeasty aroma and slightly skunky, but in a way that I associate with most German lagers.  Sweet and toast-bready, with a slightly tart aftertaste.  Very good lager.
Well-balanced, pure "beer-flavour". I liked this a lot!.....................

Skunky aroma due to green bottle I think. Clear, golden color. Sweet grainy flavor with some small bitterness in the background. This could have been a great beer but unfortunately it suffers from green bottle syndrome. Overall not that bad though, but I don't think I'll buy it again.
I'm not too much of a lagerhead, but its good for the style. Earthy, champagne-like.
Golden color light body, I like thier pils much better......................

On tap: Nice slightly malty Munich Lager. Not much in the hop department, although I was drinking this after a couple Pilsener Urquells so that might have affected my perception. Slightly sweet. Very drinkable. Brilliant yellow color. Nice beer to drink when you want to spend a while in the bar. Frightening that my idea of a session beer has 5.2% ABV!
Bit of a skunky aroma with a pretty smooth semi-sweetness. Average, but easy drinking.
Some skunk in the aroma. Damn green bottle beer. I like helles, but I rarely find one that is made right. Pasteurization and a green bottle kill what could have been a good beer.
I never heard of this beer before, and it was spectacular. I recommend this hard to find beverage.
It tastes much better than it smells, but it is not the best German Lager I have had. Maybe i had a bad batch, but it smelled a little skunky.
Boston Beer Summit '02:  This is good for a lager, OK for a beer and something I'm sure that I'll never buy.

Not a fan of lagers in general, but this is pretty good.  Clear and gold colored, it works well with a bit of bitterness in the aftertaste.  Goes down smooth.  Better on tap than the bottle, but better them most US megabrews.

You can usually find this sitting patiently, side by side with the Optimator, in the bigger beer stores.  This lager is OK for a one night stand - she's well made with a decent body and a charming sweetness that would seem reppelant in a less balanced brew.  But the Optimator provides a much more meaningful relationship.
I love Bitburger and any other German beer I've tried, but this one is amazing.  Blows all the other German brews away.  I will be looking for this from now on when I go to the store.
I hated this stuff.  Not pretty to look at, even for a pilsener.  Way too sweet for me, moderate carbonation, slight hoppy feel in the end, dont stop here.
Slightly better than average lager for mass consumption. ...................
Ordinary German lager, textbook unexceptional but good......................

Looks liek the pilsner and carries many common characteristics. Refreshing again but much cleaner. While the hops are definitely on the lighter side in this one, they do creep up a little in the aftertaste, but certainly on the sweeter side. Maybe one to recommend to the adventurous Bud fan.
I had to re-rate this one. I must've gotten it confused with a very similar one. This tasted just like Heineken, of course, a bit better. But that skunkiness is there.
A very consistent and enjoyable German Lager................................
This would be a great beer on a hot summer day.  Just an average, drinkable beer.
Nice, crisp German lager with slight sweetishness. Finishes off with a lightly bitter aftertaste. Very enjoyable.
Great beer, light tasting, nice head.  One of the German beers I like to pick up whenever I can find it.

Very drinkable.  Nice lager
with some hops flavor.  This is 
probably what American beers
tasted like 50 years ago.
Not one of the best lagers. but definatly not the worst.  Nothing to special though.

i grew up on these classic munich lagers, before the american beer rennaissance, when in middle-america the alternative was grain belt or schlitz.  nowadays it seems frighteningly anemic in color, gatorade is a more robust yellow- but still possessing a nice refreshing floral aroma that calls back the good ol days. diminutive head, a sportbra has more lace.  again, very clean, lightly malty and sweet, amiable certainly, particularly if you concentrate on visions of munich or garmisch-partenkirchen, the beer halls and ompa bands,  the snowy heights of the zugspitz, and the vivacious frauleins carrying four liter glasses of spaten in each hand.

Bottle. Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is light yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain/bread), lightly hoppy (herbs). Flavor is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Good, straightforward example of a helles.  While there are much more interesting examples out there, this would be a very good introduction to the style for someone starting out.
bitter, malty golden lager.  I'm drinking it as I type -- yeah, its bitter with a tart finish.
Pretty good lager.  I thought it tasted simular to Bitburger.  Nothing unique as far as flavor, just a nice beer to drink all evening.

this is one of my dad's favorites.  i don't think it will be a favorite of mine.  aroma is semi-sweet grain, and a little skunky.  head is frothy, and the beer itself is as light gold as most american macros.  very little carbonation.  flavor is bland, no recognizable hops, and it has an unpleasant, sour finish.  quick, someone give me an optimator.

Er, well, this is lame perhaps, but Gusler seems to have summed up my feelings about this beer quite succinctly.  There is nothing more I can add, as our opinions on this beer seem to be in total alignment.  (And we had the beer on the same day!  Freaky!   8)

Re-Rate 12/28/01: As I'm not a Lager/Pils fan, if there's one I like, it's this one. Bright gold color, big frothy head that is white, sheets of lace. Malt nose that is some what perfumy, the start sweet, the middle a bit thin, the finish is crisp and clean. Hops are present, but not dominant. Refreshing!
not at all impressed with this beer. i'm not a big lager fan, but i've tried many that are, in my opinion, better than this. i dont think this is a big step up from heineken.

I did not find it with any real hop flavor. My impression was more of a mild and slightly sweet brew. There are many other imported lagers I would pick over this one, but certainly would not turn it down if offered.
Definitely a transitional beer. Hop flavor? Not. A mild-mannered and mild-charactered lager. A SuperHeineken, without the accompanying sourness.

i'm assuming that this is the Munchener hell, because that is the premium lager isn't it? anyway found this to be similiar in taste to the Bock (but not as tasty of course), light and fruity, and a bit sweet, nice enough.
This is by far my favorite kraut beer on tap. ..............................
One of my new favorites.  It tastes a little like St. Pauli but without the skunky aroma.
Was not impressed with this beer at all.  The nose was skunk and the taste was funk.  I could of been having a bad day, but I'm pretty discourgaed from trying other Spaten beers now.
Nice, ballanced, drinkable brew. If you like piss colored German style lagers, this stuff kicks butt over Heineken, Becks, Steinlager, and most of the other mediocre, ubiquitous imports.
This was an okay beer it had a good after taste to it.......................
I have to rate this higher than like Budweiser so I'm artificially increasing my rating. This is just an uninteresting beer.
light golden colour, fine head, beautiful lace, fresh and medium hopped, some sweetness, full-bodied, firm and slightly fruity aftertaste
Another stepping stone beer. I wouldn't seek it out, but without beers like this, it would be much harder to convert the non-beer drinkers over to the side of all that is good in the world.
A waste of time compared to their other beers...............................
ok beer,it goes down with warsteiner mixed with heiniken....................
Another great german beer. A solid robust taste.............................

Poured from bottle.  Malty spice aroma.  Typical pilsener appearance - just a slight head.  decent malt/hop mix in flavor.  Good, crisp feel.  Finished ok.  One of my favorite of the majog german pils category.
Golden, nice head, ok malt aroma and taste(needed to be more evident) mixed in nicely with a mild hop bite, balanced well...good stuff but its not paulaner.
